campaign.story:
The traditional scanner can be bulky, expensive, and only have a few functions. The scanning program can be hard to navigate and make it difficult to utilize in other ways.
Introducing RiviCamer - A smart portable scanner that provides a fast and crystal clear scanning experience. Perfect for telecommuting, remote education, or work from home.
RiviCamer allows you to scan a book while flipping through it, and can scan up to three pages in just one second! 
This means you can easily scan a 180-page book in one minute, and a 900-page book in five!
Equips a 1/2.3 inch CMOS sensor, and a 32-bit MIPS processor which ensures you a perfect scan quality while keeping the information legible. The high-performance components would help meet all of your scanning needs. 
The foldable camera lets you adjust the camera 150° vertically to find the perfect angle to scan your book/files flawlessly or have a video call at home.
Scanning closer
RiviCamer is a powerful scanner, and can also be used for business meetings as your perfect assistant. It has 4 built-in microphones, supports up to 16MP filming, and can provide 1080P high-resolution video calls.
Business meetings & Video calls
The four built-in microphones also called microphone array, which is one of the HD Audio standards and one of the advanced tools in improving speech quality.

The microphone array can reduce noise and reverberation. It is valuable for noisy and long-distance equipment, which makes Rivicamer work better than the other scanner in business meetings, teaching, training, etc.
One RiviCamer is 320mm tall and weighs only 1.2kg. And the USB-C eliminated the need for a special scanner charger or transformer. You can easily put it in your bag and take it anywhere with ease.
RiviCamer can not only scan regular paper documents, but can also scan items such as passports, ID cards, receipts, toys, stamps, and more!
You can even scan the jewelry through RiviCamer to share and preserve its original look or doing a jewelry auction display.
RiviCamer’s smart scanning mode can automatically separate and merge your scanned files. The smart features include:
Automatic Cropping
Offset Correction
AutomaticPaging
Fingerprint Removal
Simultaneous Scanning of Multiple Targets
Automatic Edge Filling
Make scanning better and more efficient than ever!
With OCR (Optical Character Recognition) technology, RiviCamer can analyze, recognize and obtain text and layout information from a scanned image, then convert the captured JPG files into Word, Excel, or PDF formats for easy editing.
English, Chinese, French, German, Japanese, Danish, Spanish, Korean, Greek, Irish, Italian, Albanian, Bulgarian, Croatian, Czech, Finnish, Dutch, Hungarian, Latvian, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Slovak, Slovenian, and Turkish, etc.
Supporting 90% of international common languages, this powerful digital language library allows you to keep any text in almost any language.
Through the RiviCamer app, you can automatically optimize the color of the scanned document image, adjust the hue and contrast, combine multiple images into a PDF, run smart denoising, and other professional image editing functions. Optimize your scanned images to the highest quality.
 *The RiviCamer can support Windows 7 and Windows 10 now and the app is under development and is expected to be released in August.
The set of LED lights in RiviCamer can provide light when scanning a document and act as a desk lamp as well. These lights have four different lighting modes, which includes:
Front light mode
Bright light mode
Soft light mode
Reading mode
You can choose the light mode you need when you need it.
The intelligent high-shot instrument supports real-time live video and video recording functions and can output MJPG format and YUV format, which are suitable for teaching, remote training, or live-stream.

Dear backers,

Thank you for all your contributions to this campaign, we are grateful to have you accompany us along the way. Your enthusiasm and support are the motivation to push us forward and make the product better.
In addition to the incredible support from all the backers, the RiviCamer team is another significant reason that we achieve success for this project. Today, we’ve brought you some updates on our current production progress from the factory. Let's check it out!

Dear all,

Thank you so much for your support! All the achievements can’t be fulfilled without your love and contributions!
We are pleased to see that a lot of backers show their support for RiviCamer. Here we would like to invite you to share this campaign with your family and friends, and spread out our product from our referral program.

Dear Backers,


Thank you for your huge support to help our campaign successfully funded and make our dream a reality! It means a lot to us and keeps motivating us to make a better product.

campaign.story:
Once you hear them, it's too late...
Jovian Whispers is a campaign and sourcebook for the Shadows Over Sol roleplaying game. It follows up on the mystery of the Jupiter Group Incident, in which all four Jovian colonies went suddenly and inexplicably silent.
No one knows the cause of this mysterious event, but somewhere in the dark and ruined colonies of Jupiter the Insurrection Virus uses its clanking machines to plot the downfall of all humanity...
Jovian Whispers is inspired by a variety of science fiction media, ranging from James S. A. Corey’s excellent The Expanse series and Arthur C. Clarke's Space Odyssey books, to Ridley Scott’s classic film Alien and James Cameron's Terminator movies.
The Jovian Whispers campaign and sourcebook will be a full-color hardback volume estimated at 160 pages. It includes:
A flexible campaign consisting of five core scenarios, plus numerous optional "side trek" adventures and ample room for GM-created personal plots.
Complete details on the Jovian colonies and the Jupiter Group Incident, with numerous plot hooks and potential for future adventures.
The secrets of the Insurrection Virus, the intelligent malware that caused the downfall of the Jovian colonies.
Plus, plenty of terrifying new foes and challenges to keep the players gasping in horror for years to come!
 “Great setting with a ton of awesome info and backstory and cool art...”
                                                                               —Jack M., DriveThruRPG
Two hundred years from now what should be the shining beacon of the future is instead cloaked in conspiracy and horror. Humankind has expanded throughout the solar system, and there it has discovered mysteries older than humanity.
The culture has shattered into myriad subcultures; nation-states are the hollow shells of what they once were. Corporations and other groups wage small-scale wars in the streets or in space. Bioengineered horrors left over from these conflicts stalk the hulls of ruined stations and abandoned colonies.
But for an enterprising team willing to brave the horrors, there's always a profit to be made.
The Shadows Over Sol core rulebook was first published in 2016. Since then, thirteen adventures, five supplements, seven accessories and a full campaign have been published for the game line. Jovian Whispers will be one of the largest and most ambitious additions to date!
 Dark things lurk in Jupiter's shadow...
Below are the stretch goals that have been unveiled thus far. They may be unlocked either at specific dollar amounts or at a specific number of patrons for Tab Creations' accompanying Patreon project.
UNLOCKED! - $3000 - One-Sheet Scenario - This funding level unlocks a short adventure supplement for Shadows Over Sol, following up on one of the many plot threads introduced in Jovian Whispers. It will be made available to all backers in PDF.
UNLOCKED! - $4000 - Sol and Jovian System Poster Map - This stretch goal unlocks a poster map of the Sol system, with an inset of the Jovian moons and colonies. It will be made available to all backers in a high-resolution image format, and available in print as an add-on. 
UNLOCKED! - $5000 or 31 Patrons - One-Sheet Scenario #2 - This funding level unlocks a second short adventure supplement for Shadows Over Sol, following up on another plot thread introduced in Jovian Whispers. It will be made available to all backers in PDF. This goal may be unlocked either at the indicated dollar amount or at the given number of Patrons on Tab Creations' accompanying Patreon project.
UNLOCKED! - $6000 - One-Sheet Scenario #3 - This stretch goal unlocks a third short adventure supplement for Shadows Over Sol, following up on one of the many plot threads introduced in Jovian Whispers. It will be made available to all backers in PDF.
UNLOCKED! - $7000 - System Hacks - This funding level unlocks a short PDF supplement featuring a variety of system hacks and optional rules for tweaking the tone and game play of Shadows Over Sol. It will be made available to all backers and patrons. 
UNLOCKED! - $8000 or 33 Patrons  - One-Sheet Scenario #4 - This stretch goal unlocks a fourth short adventure supplement for Shadows Over Sol, following up on one of the many plot threads introduced in Jovian Whispers. It will be made available to all backers in PDF. This goal may be unlocked either at the indicated dollar amount or at the given number of Patrons on Tab Creations' accompanying Patreon project.
UNLOCKED! - $9,000 - Jovian Epilogue - This stretch goal unlocks a short PDF with an epilogue, describing some of the ways that the Sol system, and Jovian colonies, might change in the wake of the events of Jovian Whispers. It will be made available to all backers and patrons.
 “Love the Saga Machine system... Going to adapt the system to other RPGs!”
                                                                               —James C., DriveThruRPG
Jovian Whispers for Shadows Over Sol combines the mystique of science fiction with the intensity and danger of the horror genre. The core system, Saga Machine, has been in use for a decade, including publication in our other roleplaying games, Age of Ambition, Against the Dark Yogi and Dime Adventures. This version of the rules was published in 2016 and has received widespread praise. We have 4.9/5 stars on DriveThruRPG!
Gameplay highlights from the core rulebook include:
Support for a wide range of science fiction themes and tones.
Campaign options specifically designed to adapt to different levels of horror. Easily dial your game down to survival horror or up to action horror!
An engineering system for inventing or improving upon existing technology.
A hacking system designed to engage all members of the party. No longer are the rest of your players going to sit and wait for one player to finish the hacking minigame!
A combat system designed for tense and deadly confrontations.
A wide selection of gear and bioengineered monstrosities to terrify your players!
Want to know more?
All backers can access the complete draft text of Jovian Whispers today! Simply follow the link from the first backer-only update!
A free Quick-Start for the Shadows Over Sol roleplaying game is also available.
Jovian Whispers has been in development for over three years. The campaign has gone through multiple iterations and has received several rounds of playtests. The text has been written, we have some great art in the works and we can't wait to share this project with the world!
Shadows Over Sol has seen development and play as a homebrew setting since 2009, and this incarnation of the rules is the result of over two years of development and public playtests.

Delivery
Jovian Whispers is written and ready for editing, then layout. All delivery estimates refer to the PDF copy. The physical book will ship a couple months later, giving us time to correct any typos that backers find before the final book goes to print.
Digital stretch goals will be fulfilled as they are completed, with any physical stretch goals being sent out as a single shipment once all are ready.
Digital Rewards
We will deliver all PDF materials through DriveThruRPG and the Tab Creations website.
Physical Rewards
You will pay for shipping after the Kickstarter using a pledge manager. This helps ensure that we neither overcharge nor undercharge you.
We Ship Anywhere in the World
As a small game company we do our own fulfillment, which allows us a certain amount of flexibility. This does, unfortunately, lead to high international shipping costs at times.
If you have any questions, feel free to contact us for a shipping estimate for your location. You can also use the handy calculator at USPS.com.
To save on international shipping, consider having one friend pledge for your group, adding on additional books to a single package.
The following add-ons are available for any backer of the project: just add the appropriate amount to your pledge. You will have an additional chance to do this after the Kickstarter by using the pledge manager. All print add-ons also include the associated PDFs.
Thanks as always for your support of our small business!

Our most popular RPG using the Saga Machine system, Shadows Over Sol is a game of science fiction and horror set in our own solar system some 200 years in the future. Players can take any number of roles, ranging from determined explorers or hardened military personnel, to corp troubleshooters or profit-driven “scrappers” that skirt the gray areas of the law.
The Shadows Over Sol core rulebook is a 240-page full-color hardback. More information can be found on the Shadows Over Sol webpage.
Siren's Call campaign and sourcebook

Siren's Call is a campaign and sourcebook that follows the story of the ARC Project, humanity's first ever attempt to build and launch an interstellar colony ship. If successful, it will transport some 10,000 colonists the 4.4 light years from Sol to the planet Siren, orbiting Alpha Centauri A. No one knows what challenges and horrors the colonists will face as they make a life on this new world.
Siren's Call is a 240-page full-color hardback.

Hello friends, fans and gaming family!
We have just sent out the first few backer surveys as part of a smoke test. If this test doesn't reveal any issues with the survey, most of you will receive yours on Thursday.
Once you receive yours, please fill it out ASAP. Doing so is necessary to fulfill your rewards. If you have not received a survey by Friday, please let us know and we'll make sure that you get one.
  Progress

We're really been blown away by the amount of support that you've shown us. This is without a doubt one of our most successful Kickstarters ever. You are all awesome! And I know we say this a bunch, but we really couldn’t have done it without your support. Thank you from all of us at Tab Creations!
As you likely know by now, the funding period ended a few moments ago with a final pledge total of $11,774! This means that not only are we been fully funded, but together we unlocked SEVEN stretch goals as well.

As always, thank you so much for your support. You guys are awesome, and we couldn't do it without you!
Upcoming Stretch Goals

The Jovian Whispers Kickstarter launched a week ago today and it's doing great! Thank you so much for your support! And a special heartfelt shout out to everyone who has helped spread the word!
The initial funding goal was met in the first day. Since then, the Kickstarter has blown through three stretch goals, unlocking two scenarios and the Sol system poster map. 
Additionally, as of the time of this writing, we're only $725 away from unlocking a third scenario and away from unlocking the System Hacks document. If this momentum keeps up, is in the running to be one of our Kickstarters ever!

campaign.story:
In Ironsworn: Starforged, you are a spaceborne hero sworn to undertake perilous quests. You will explore uncharted space, unravel the secrets of a mysterious galaxy, and build bonds with those you meet in your travels. Most importantly, you will swear iron vows and see them fulfilled—no matter the cost.
Starforged  is a standalone follow-up to the Ironsworn tabletop roleplaying game. Experience with Ironsworn is not required to play. Starforged builds on Ironsworn's award-winning innovations (including its famed solo play!) to chart a path into an exciting new frontier.
Starforged is designed and developed by Shawn Tomkin, the original creator of Ironsworn. Shawn, in collaboration with indie tabletop publisher Absolute Tabletop and a talented team of artists, writers, and consultants, is bringing Starforged to Kickstarter to fund production of the book, pack it with inspiring art, and deliver physical and digital copies to you. 
With your support, we've unlocked a vast array of stretch goals! Here's a summary of what we've accomplished on this journey:
Project Funded (Unlocked!): At $15K, Starforged is funded!
Custom Roll20 Sheet (Unlocked!): At $25K, we create a custom Roll20 sheet for Starforged! 
Faction Oracles (Unlocked!): At $40K, we create a set of oracles to generate stellar factions. Included in the core rulebook!
More Art (Unlocked!): At $80K, we create even more gorgeous art for the core rulebook!
Web-Based Oracle Dashboard (Unlocked!): At $125K, we create a web-based dashboard for Starforged oracles! See update #4 for details.
Starship Schematic Illustration (Unlocked!): At $150K, we commission a two-page schematic illustration of a Forge starship! See update #5 for details.
Asset Boost (Unlocked!): At $175K, we create 10 new character assets for the print-and-play and printed asset decks! See update #8 for details.
Sector Starters (Unlocked!): At $200K, we create inspiring Sector Starters as a digital download for all backers! See update #8 for details.
Tabletop Audio Tracks (Bonus Reward Unlocked!): We commission Tim Roven of Tabletop Audio to create five 10-minute tracks! See update #10 for details.
Total Upgrade (Unlocked!):  At 5,000 backers, we deliver upgraded components at no extra cost! See update #15 for details.
Sundered Isles (Unlocked!): At $300K, we develop a supplement of fantasy seafaring adventure!  See update #15 for details.
The Sundered Isles Stretch Goal - Seafaring Adventure Powered by Starforged!
The Book
This campaign funds production of the Ironsworn: Starforged core rulebook. This will be a 6x9 inch (about A5) book of 300 or more pages. The Digital Edition, available at all pledge levels, will be fully indexed and bookmarked. The Deluxe Edition, available in the Deluxe Edition Hardcover and Deluxe Bundle pledges, will be a high-quality offset-printed product. 
Mockup of the Starforged Deluxe Hardcover
The Digital and Deluxe Editions of the Starforged rulebook will contain:
 Chapter 1 – The Basics: An introduction to Starforged, the fundamentals of the game, and the aspects of your character.
 Chapter 2 – Launching Your Campaign: Work through these exercises to define the nature of your setting, create your character, setup a starting location, and undertake your first quest.
 Chapter 3 – Gameplay in Depth: Extended details and advice for playing Starforged. 
 Chapter 4 – Foes and Encounters: What will you face within the depths of the Forge? Find out within!
 Chapter 5 – Oracles: An extensive set of oracle tables, which are the inspiration engine for playing Starforged.
Mockup of the interior of the Starforged Deluxe Hardcover.
Preview Edition
Ready to play Starforged? You're in luck! As a thanks for your support, all backers gain immediate access to the digital Preview Edition. Check the first backers-only update for the link!
See the video below for a flip-through of the Preview Edition rulebook.
PLAY

This Preview Edition includes core chapters from the Starforged rulebook, along with printable asset cards and reference materials. It's everything you need to get started.
Here's what you get in the Preview Edition core rulebook.
 The Basics: Learn how to play Ironsworn: Starforged. 
 Launching Your Campaign: Guided exercises for establishing the truths of your setting, creating your character, discovering a starting location and situation, and getting your story underway. 
 Oracles: A compete set of oracle tables for generating narrative prompts, spaceborne locations and situations, planets, settlements, starships, creatures, characters, mysterious derelicts, ancient alien vaults, and more. It's narrative fuel for exciting, perilous, no-prep adventure--with or without a GM!
The Preview Edition rulebook is about 230 pages, has a clean, sharp design, is packed with amazing artwork, and is fully bookmarked and hyperlinked.
Asset Deck
Alongside the core rulebook, we are funding a high-quality deck of printed asset cards.
Mockup of Starforged asset cards (icons and design by Nathen Græy).
Assets are a key component of your character. They represent your background, skills, traits, companions, and resources. 75 or more poker-sized asset cards are planned for the final deck, featuring icons and graphic design by Nathen Græy.
Mockup of the Starforged Asset Deck (icons and design by Nathen Græy)
Select the Deluxe Bundle pledge to include the printed asset deck in your backer rewards, or choose it as an add-on. One deck is all you need for everyone at the table.
All backers will also receive a PDF of print-and-play asset cards. 
Reference Guide
We're also funding production of the wire-bound Starforged Reference Guide.
Mockup of the Starforged wirebound Reference Guide cover.
This 6x9 (about A5) book will lie perfectly flat at your table and contain rule summaries, moves, and the complete set of Starforged oracles. It's everything you need to keep your story moving. Page count is currently estimated at 120 or more pages.
Mockup of the Starforged wirebound Reference Guide interior.
Select the Deluxe Bundle pledge to include the Starforged Reference Guide in your backer rewards, or add one or more to your pledge as an add-on.
The Setting
Your people came to the Forge two centuries ago in the wake of a cataclysm . Today, this new home offers opportunity and peril. Remnants of ancient civilizations hold dangerous knowledge and forbidden power. Your people build settlements on new worlds, but those places rarely offer a safe haven. Conflicts often rage between people and factions. Pirates prowl the spaceways in search of easy prey. Baneful creatures and dark forces dwell on corrupted planets and in the abyssal void between stars.
Encounter creatures both wonderous and horrifying (Art by Joshua Meehan).
The default tone for Starforged is human-centric science fiction on a perilous frontier. This is a scavenged future, with starships cobbled together from salvage. People cling to survival on inhospitable worlds and in remote space stations. Much has been forgotten or lost.
Visit Remote Settlements on perilous worlds (Art by Joshua Meehan).
It's a dangerous life for anyone living in the Forge, and doubly so for the Ironsworn—those adventurers bound to sworn quests.
Swear iron vows and see them fulfilled or forsaken (Art by Joshua Meehan).
Inspiration comes from the the quest-driven adventures of The Mandalorian, the lived-in aesthetic and outer-rim locations of the original Star Wars trilogy, the workaday exploits of Firefly, the isolated suspense and industrial grittiness of Alien, the desperation and retro-tech of the modern reboot of Battlestar Galactica, the mysticism of Dune, and the cosmic mysteries and class struggles of The Expanse. It's all blended together into a heady stew of perilous sci-fi adventure, and topped with a dollop of Guardians of the Galaxy gonzo.
Most aspects of the setting can be adjusted to your preferences. The campaign launch exercises offer inspiring prompts and guidance to immerse you in a galaxy of your own creation. 
The Art
Starforged is packed with amazing illustrations by lead artist Joshua Meehan. Josh composites photos, textures, 3d objects, and hand-painted elements to create a vibrant, cinematic rendering of the people, places, and perils of the Forge.
Set off on perilous expeditions (Art by Joshua Meehan).
Josh uses the Starforged oracle tables and generators to help build the unique subjects and aspects of each illustration. The art is directly inspired by the game!
Development process for an Ironsworn: Starforged illustration - from initial concept to finished piece (Art by Joshua Meehan).
Explore mysterious precursor sites (Art by Joshua Meehan)
It's a perilous galaxy, so consider bringing an ally (Art by Joshua Meehan).
Face deadly foes in high-action battles (Art by Joshua Meehan)
The System
Starforged is true to Ironsworn's roots, tuned to fit the spaceborne setting, while incorporating experience and feedback from years of development and play. 
If you're new to Ironsworn, here's a summary of how it works.
Three Ways to Play
Like it's predecessor,  Ironsworn: Starforged offers three ways to play.
 Guided: One or more players take the role of their characters, while a guide moderates the session.
 Co-Op You and one or more friends play together to overcome challenges and complete quests. A guide is not required.
 Solo: You portray a lone character driven to fulfill vows in a dangerous galaxy. Good luck!
Your Character
The Starforged playscape, with print-and-play asset cards and character sheet.
Your character in Starforged is composed of stats and trackers. These elements help you determine the outcome when you perform risky actions.
As you complete quests, make discoveries, and form bonds, you gain experience. You spend this experience to add assets—vehicles, modules, paths, companions, and deeds—which deepen your abilities and options.
Character creation is fast and flexible, with a guided exercise to help define your background, resources, expertise, and goals.
Moves
Moves are self-contained systems to resolve an action, scene, or question. There are moves to cover most uncertain or risky situations you encounter in Starforged. 
For solo and co-op play,  moves help resolve your actions and trigger new opportunities and complications. For guided play, moves take an active role in the conversation between the guide and the other players.
Sample move from Starforged.
Ironsworn: Starforged moves are inspired by the innovative, fiction-first mechanics of the Apocalypse World system created by D. Vincent Baker and Meguey Baker.
Momentum
The momentum meter is one of your character's most important mechanical attributes.
Momentum is a special mechanic which is core to playing Starforged.  You can gain momentum as an outcome or option when making moves. This represents securing advantages, acquiring new insight, and making progress in your quests. You lose momentum when you suffer a cost which causes a delay or puts you at a disadvantage.
You can use momentum to gain a decisive result — or avoid dire failure — on a critical move.
Action Roll
When you make a move representing a risky or uncertain action, roll three dice at once:  An action die (D6) and two challenge dice (D10). Add your relevant stat and any bonuses to your action die. This is your action score.  Then, compare your action score to each of the challenge dice and check for a strong hit, weak hit, or miss. The move will tell you how to interpret the result.
There are three possible outcomes for the action roll:
 Strong Hit: Your action score beats (is greater than) both the challenge dice. You succeed at what you are trying to do.
 Weak Hit: Your action score beats only one of the challenge dice. You succeed, but with a cost or lesser effect.
 Miss: Your action score doesn't beat either challenge die. You fail, or must make serious concessions
The Oracles
Starforged Oracles are random prompts and generators which help answer questions in solo or co-op games, or provide creative backup for the guide in guided play. They are an inspiration engine--ready to introduce amazing locations, surprising revelations, and dire challenges to your Starforged campaign.
Mockup of oracle tables within the Starforged rulebook.
If you loved the oracles in Ironsworn, you'll find much more to love here. It's an entire galaxy of possibilities! Plus, these tables are largely system agnostic and can be paired with other sci-fi systems. 
Starforged oracles are included in the Preview Edition, which is an immediate reward for backing this campaign.
Shipping Info
The pledge levels do not include shipping. After the Kickstarter concludes, you will pay shipping for any physical rewards through the pledge manager. 
Here is a list of shipping estimates by region. 
Contiguous USA: $11-$16
EU/UK: $20-$25
Norway/Switzerland: $33-$41
Canada: $20-$25
Australia: $21-$25
New Zealand: $21-$34
China, Macao, Hong Kong: $12-$17
Rest of Asia: $24-$36
All Other Countries: $57-$120
We are customs-friendly in the UK/EU and many other regions! Check the FAQ for details.
Pledge levels and the shipping fees above do not include VAT. If VAT fees apply in your region, you will be charged those fees in the pledge manager after the campaign ends. However, we want to alleviate these charges as much as we can,  so we will cover 50% of your VAT fees!
Legacy Add-Ons
In collaboration with DriveThruRG, we are offering Ironsworn books and cards as add-on rewards during this campaign. These materials are not completely compatible with Starforged, but include mechanics, tips, and guidelines which might help enrich your Starforged campaigns. Plus, they allow you to experience vow-driven quests in the perilous fantasy setting of the Ironlands. These are the existing editions of these books and cards, and are not new versions or reprints.
The bad news: Shipping on these legacy items is managed separately through DriveThruRPG, and shipping cannot be combined with physical Starforged rewards. 
The good news: You'll receive your reward codes after this Kickstarter campaign ends. You can order your legacy books and cards at that time, rather than waiting for release of Starforged. 
As a thank you for supporting Starforged, printed legacy add-ons are discounted from current prices by about 15-20%. You can select these add-ons when choosing your backer level. If you add a legacy item to your pledge, you'll receive a code to purchase that item from DriveThruRPG for the cost of production and shipping.   Check this page at DriveThruRPG for current estimated shipping costs.
 Ironsworn Print Edition - Set off on perilous quests with this 270-page core rulebook. Winner of a Gold ENNIE award! 
 Ironsworn Asset Deck (Printed Deck) - Upgrade your Ironsworn playscape with a deck of printed asset cards.  
 Ironsworn: Delve - With a vast array of new options and tools, Ironsworn: Delve is the perfect companion for your Ironsworn campaign. Winner of a Silver ENNIE award! 
 Ironsworn: Delve Site Cards (Printed Deck) - Explore perilous sites with these tarot-sized cards. 
Legacy card add-ons are recommended for US customers only. There are no card printing facilities for DriveThruRPG outside of the US, and shipping costs are high in most other countries. If you order both book and card legacy rewards, DriveThruRPG will charge separate shipping for the cards.
Remember: the Ironsworn core rulebook remains entirely free in PDF and is available for download now at ironswornrpg.com
Process & Principles
The State of Things
Starforged is currently in development, and this campaign will fund final production and delivery of the core rulebook and other game materials.
Here's what's done:
Core mechanics and game design
Playtesting and revisions
Writing, design, layout, and illustrations for about 60-70% of the core rulebook
Asset card design and icon designs
Initial development and layout of 75 character assets
Creation of reference sheets and worksheets
Here's what remains:
Development and layout of additional core rulebook content, including the expanded gameplay chapter and the encounters chapter
Development of additional illustrations and graphic elements
Development of safety tools/content
Additional minor revisions in response to testing and feedback
Development of an index for the core rulebook
Final polish pass and editing for all content
Development of summarized rules reference content for the Reference Guide
Layout of the Reference Guide (where it differs from the Core Rulebook)
Print proofing and production
Shipping
Delivery Timeline
We are estimating that development will be complete by March 2022. Once Starforged is complete, digital rewards will be delivered, and production and fulfillment of print rewards will begin. 
The No-Drama Vow
We appreciate your trust in us. In exchange, we swear (on iron!) the following:
We will make no fewer than one backer update per month, with clear communication of current status.
We will share periodic releases of the remaining material as it is developed, including complete new sections and chapters added to the Preview Edition. You'll have early access and visibility into progress.
If the timeline is projected to change for any reason, we will proactively notify you of that change and set out the new timeline.
Open Licensing
If this campaign is successful, Starforged will be accompanied by a Creative Commons license to make the material open and accessible to other creators.
The entirety of the Starforged text will be released under a Creative Commons, non-commercial share-alike license.
An SRD will be produced which makes the primary mechanics of Starforged available for everyone, and usable by creators under an open commercial license.
The Team
 Shawn Tomkin (Creator): Shawn is a graphic designer (by day) and RPG creator (by night) who developed the ENNIE-winning Ironsworn tabletop roleplaying game and its follow-up supplement, Delve. Follow Shawn on Twitter @shawntomkin.
 Joshua Meehan (Lead Artist): Joshua Meehan currently lives in Tucson, Arizona. He has worked on many of his favorite properties such as Dishonored 2 and Pathfinder. He has carried a lifelong passion for science fiction that began with his childhood '97 VHS boxset of Star Wars and grew to envelop every Sci-fi IP he could find. See more of his work on twitter @joshmeehanart or at joshmeehanart.com.
 Absolute Tabletop (Co-Publisher and Contributors): Absolute Tabletop is Michael Barker, Matt Click, James Kearney, and Tim Kearney. They have successfully funded five projects on Kickstarter, including Adventure Kit: Oath of the Frozen King, a fully customizable adventure module and session prep toolkit; A Dead Man’s Guide to Dragongrin, a one-of-a-kind campaign setting guide; and The Mecha Hack: Mission Manual, a supplement to their bestselling rules-lite mecha RPG. Follow them on Twitter @AbTabletop, and visit their website at absolutetabletop.com.
 Nathen Græy (Graphic design/Illustration): Nathen has been flirting on and off with TTRPGs since 1985 when he was first introduced to the D&D Red Box. Born and raised in Hertfordshire, England and now a native of the Pacific Northwest, he spends his days cozying up with a cup of tea, bonding over My Hero Academia with his son, and having alarmingly bad dice rolls. Like statistically, impossibly bad. When he's not working as a graphic designer and illustrator, he's sharing his love for TTRPGs through multiple passion projects, most recently, the successfully crowdfunded RolePins. Follow him across the interwebs via linktr.ee/owlbare.
 Sara Thompson (Disability Consultant): Sara Thompson is a disabled TTRPG writer, game designer, and disability consultant. She created the homebrewed Combat Wheelchair for 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons and has worked on numerous roleplaying games, including The Witcher (R. Talsorian Games), Cyberpunk RED (R. Talsorian Games), Starfinder and Pathfinder 2nd Edition (Paizo Games), Bardsung (Steam Forged Games) and Hellboy: The Roleplaying Game (Red Scar Gaming/Mantic Games). Sara can be found on her Twitter @mustangsart.
 Kienna Shaw (Safety Tools Consultant and Writer): Kienna is a TTRPG designer, streamer, and community creator. She is one of the co-curators of the ENNIE-winning TTRPG Safety Toolkit, a free living resource that compiles TTRPG safety/support tools and systems in one place. When not working on making TTRPG safety more approachable and accessible, Kienna is seen around the internet self-publishing micro games, contributing to publications such as Candlekeep Mysteries (Dungeons and Dragons) and Sea of Legends (Guildhall Studios), and appearing as an actual-play streamer and co-producer of Salty Sweet Games.  Find the TTRPG Safety Toolkit at bit.ly/ttrpgsafetytoolkit or twitter.com/ttrpgsafetykit, and find Kienna on their Twitter @KiennaS.
 Lauren Bryant-Monk (Safety Tools Consultant and Writer): Lauren is dedicated making the Tabletop Industry safer, more diverse, and full of smooches. She is a game designer, safety editor, and the co-curator of the TTRPG Safety Toolkit. Lauren is also an video game and actual play streamer with a particular interest in solo TTRPGs, and streams long-play anthology campaigns of solo games on her own channel, StarvingSoubrette. Find the TTRPG Safety Toolkit at bit.ly/ttrpgsafetytoolkit or twitter.com/ttrpgsafetykit, and Lauren at @jl_nicegirl.
 Ayethin (Digital Tools Developer): Ayethin is a Software Developer, Artist, and RPG Enthusiast. They currently improve and maintain the Ironsworn character sheets on Roll20, aiming to give the best user experience possible for someone playing the game digitally. Follow them on Twitter @MHeihin.
 rsek (Digital Tools Developer): When rsek was small, a sandhill crane bit their right hand and cursed it with restlessness. Ever since, rsek has occupied it with diverse arts, including: origami, TTRPGs, procedural generation, watercolour and digital illustration...and birdwatching, in case the crane comes back. They were last spotted in the Unceded Coast Salish Territories, in a settlement known to some as Vancouver, Canada. Follow them on Twitter @rsek.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Shawn has developed and delivered two previous books in the Ironsworn series, and a large portion of the development of Starforged is complete and delivered as an immediate reward in this Kickstarter. Playtesting has been underway for several months. Much of the art for the book has already been completed. 

Absolute Tabletop has developed dozens of RPG products, and managed four successful Kickstarter projects. They have experience with fulfillment and logistics, and will help ensure a smooth delivery for our valued backers.

Because this project involves a larger team than previous Ironsworn products, we may encounter delays due to a specific individual's availability. We will put measures in place to ensure that no one (including Shawn) is an indispensable resource that would cause a failure to deliver. We will keep the backers informed about what is happening with the project, and will provide regular preview releases of the book as it is developed. 

We may also encounter delays due to unexpected issues with production and shipping. Working with our fulfillment partners, we will make our best effort to identify and resolve any issues before they impact the backers. 

Shawn has always believed in open and transparent communication with Ironsworn fans, and this project will be no exception. Thank you for putting your trust in us.

updates.update_content:
That’s a wrap!
Twenty-nine days, 6,782 backers, and $347,983 pledged in support of Ironsworn: Starforged! We’ve said it before, but it really cannot be overstated—this campaign completely exceeded our wildest expectations, and we cannot thank you enough for being our allies on this journey.
So, what now?

updates.update_userinfo: Some Quick Notes on Finalizing Your Pledge
updates.update_content:
Hello, Ironsworn!
We just wanted to drop a quick update to ensure everyone has their pledge dialed in before the campaign closes! We have gained lots of new folk in the last few days, so it's a good time to go through some items we've covered previously.
Here's a few things to keep in mind!

The Ironsworn Starforged Kickstarter Ends Soon!
This is it! 29 days. More than 6,300 backers. Only a few hours remain. 
We're in the final stretch, but still seeing a steady influx of new backers. Welcome new arrivals! We're thrilled to have you aboard. Be sure to check out the pinned backer update for access to the Starforged Preview Edition, and let us know what you think.

Ahoy, there Ironsworn!
Needless to say, our excitement and gratitude over this incredible milestone is boundless. We’ve cruised past the $300,000 mark — a destination that seemed so distant a week ago, now fully in our ship’s wake.
Our final stretch goal of the campaign is unlocked, thanks to your support. Shawn and the team at Absolute Tabletop will be creating the Sundered Isles, a fantasy age-of-sail supplement powered by . This digital reward will be made available to as a thank you for your enthusiasm and support, and to celebrate the incredible success of this Kickstarter campaign.

updates.update_userinfo: How-to: Updating Your Digital Pledge with a Print Add-On
updates.update_content:
Hello, Ironsworn!
We've had a few questions from digital tier backers about Starforged print add-ons, and we thought it'd be best to dig into that topic in a backer update.
Due to a quirk in the way that Kickstarter handles digital tiers and physical add-ons, you aren't able to select a Starforged add-on if you are a Digital Edition backer.  But some of you have asked if you can add a deck of Starforged asset cards or the reference guide to your Digital Edition pledge, and the short answer is yes, absolutely.  So how can we make that happen? It's pretty simple! Let's dig in.

A Wayfarer’s Journey
A lone wayfarer discovered a land in the far reaches of his world. He called it the Ironlands. It was a cold and inhospitable place, full of dark forests and rugged hills. But he made it a home, and sent out a message that others were welcome there.
Time passed. The wayfarer wandered alone among the reaches of the Ironlands. He grew accustomed to the solitude, and did not mind.

campaign.story:
Corsairs of Cthulhu:  Fighting Mythos in the Golden Age of Piracy, is a Call of Cthulhu 7th edition source book  licensed by Chaosium. The book will feature the beautiful art work of  Joel Bisaillon,  brought to you by New Comet Games, the same people who brought you the award-winning Call of Cthulhu book Devil's Swamp.
Corsairs of Cthulhu is a rules and setting supplement to the Call of Cthulhu role-playing game and focuses on the period between 1650 and 1730 CE. Your keeper can set up your investigators as crew on a pirate or privateer ship, freelancers in one of the Caribbean ports who love the gold doubloon more than a foreign governments rule, or even provide your investigators with their own ship. Working together the investigators must face evil Mythos, real and imagined. Curses left by ancient civilizations and hidden nightmares around the world.
The golden age of piracy is a time of spreading empires. England, France, Spain, Italy as well as several other smaller countries are planting their flags and colonies on any piece of land they can find. Empires rise and fall, Spanish ships are hauling new found gold from the new world back to Spain and ships are lost to pirates and storms regularly. Governments authorize privateers to sail under their flag but can raise the black when needed.
 There are new skills, new professions, famous NPCs and new weapons that the investigators must learn to use if they want to survive against not only the dangers of the Mythos, but also against disease, dehydration, sea monsters, warships, and other pirates.
Corsairs of Cthulhu is not just a setting book anticipated to be approximately 360 pages, but also contains a full campaign, The Map of the Astronomer. This campaign will take your investigators to ports unknown, fantastical lands out of this world and come face to face with some of the most dangerous Elder Gods and dark creatures ever faced. Can anything prepare the investigators for the finale and the most terrifying deity of all time.
Many of the adventures could be run as standalone, but it is designed as a full campaign. Your ship and ports of call will provide replacement investigators as needed.

updates.update_content:
We will be sending out a quick survey to everyone this morning. All we are really looking for is if you do have a physical book, where will it be shipped.  If you don't have a physical book, are you planning to upgrade to one, and if so where will it be shipped.

We've broken it down into 5 choices. USA, Canada, EU/Europe, Australia and Everywhere else.

After 30 days, 841 backers, 16 Updates, 10 Stretch Goals, 660 books sold and almost $55 thousand dollars, the campaign is finally done. Thank you all so much for supporting us.
We did fall $138 short of the 10th stretch goal, but we wanted to thank you for all your support and unlocked the 10th Stretch goal right before we ended. We will be adding in the Pulp material so you have the option to play as standard Call of Cthulhu, or use the Pulp Cthulhu rules.

updates.update_userinfo: Corsairs of Cthulhu 9th Stretch Goal Reached!
updates.update_content:
We Unlocked the 9th Stretch Goal tonight with 21 hours left to go.  We are still going strong and if we can just do a bit better in this last day, as we did today, we have a chance to get to that huge 10th Stretch Goal and add in the Pulp Cthulhu options.
For the 9th Goal we will be adding in at least 2 more Plot hook/Adventure ideas for you as the Keeper to give you ideas to run your adventures. We have been brainstorming some here, and have some wickedly creepy ideas, we think you will love.

What an exciting finish to this record breaking campaign for us. We are so pleased by everyone jumping in and helping out. Things are moving along smoothly and we expect to easily reach the next Stretch Goal #9. But we are worried about reaching #10, the Pulp Cthulhu level. We know some of you would not be interested in this, but many are very interested. Help us reach that goal.  We just passed 700 backers and are hoping to reach 800!
We are advertising and spreading the word, but we need you, the backer, to join in and help us out, by sharing it, talking about it, and re-posting it where you can on Social Media.

updates.update_userinfo: Corsairs of Cthulhu: 8th Stretch Goal Reached!
updates.update_content:
3rd Weeks can always be tough, but we continued to grow all week and just a few minutes ago we surpassed the 8th Stretch Goal. 
What does this do for you? We already have the map for the Cronus which is a large Armed Brig, and we will also be putting in the typical Corsair ship, and now we will be adding a 3rd ship map. These will help you with ship to ship combats and being able to provide ships for players.

updates.update_userinfo: Corsairs of Cthulhu: The Astronomer's Map
updates.update_content:
Just wanted to jump on and talk a little about the Astronomer's Map. A lot of you have purchased the Physical Copy Complete Level, which gives you a bunch of goodies but the big item is the 3d printed Map and Key.
The campaign kicks off with your captain owning one of the pieces and driven to find the rest. In the first scene you acquire the 2nd piece of the map and the main part of the key.

We are in the slow 3rd week right now, this is pretty normal, but we are still climbing up and are well over half-way to the next stretch goal. 
We wanted to let everyone know we have received the 3d printed model of the Astronomers map and Key and we'll be making a video this week to show it off.  It looks great!
We also wanted to share our first Cartography map. We hope you enjoy this.

updates.update_userinfo: Corsairs of Cthulhu: 7th Stretch Goal Reached!
updates.update_content:
We hit the next stretch goal, which will add in at least 2 new plot hooks/adventure ideas into the book. We will stay away from the movie tropes that have been put into films (ie. cursed treasure that turns you undead, etc..) and we will stay away from the ideas I've already included in the campaign.  
We will be taking suggestions from you and if we get several ideas we like we may add more than two. So feel free to send us ideas and we'll start a list to go with our own and pick the ones we like the best.

We are coming up on the half-way point of the campaign and continue to grow and could not be happier. We are quickly closing in on the next stretch goal, only a few hundred left. 
We are also working on our maps and art, and it is rolling in. Meanwhile the campaign is rolling along and every play session is invaluable in continuing to make the book better, and batter.
Here is just a sample of the great art. We hope you like it.

campaign.story:
THIS IS AN UNPARALLELED AGE. A galactic age.
An age of bounty hunters, vagrants and bleeding-heart outlaws.
This is the NEW REBEL ERA, and the only thing worth a damn is the sweat off your back, the bullet in your chamber and the fuel in your tank. The galaxy is a lawless expanse, known as the FRONTIER GALAXY, and you are an INTERSTELLAR OUTLAW. Together with YOUR SHIP and YOUR CREW you have to eke out a living in the Frontier Galaxy, and chase down the intergalactic dream of freedom and success.
ORBITAL BLUES is a new lo-fi space western roleplaying game from SoulMuppet Publishing, written by Sam Sleney & Zachary Cox.  A roleplaying love-letter to off-beat sci-fi, vintage music, and cooperative old-school styled roleplay, Orbital Blues allows you to play out rules-light tabletop adventures in the style of space westerns such as Cowboy Bebop, Firefly and Guardians of the Galaxy.
Stepping into the shoes of Interstellar Outlaws, players band together to form Crews, and navigate a hard-going, gig-economy living on the fringes of a space-faring society.
Developed on the critically acclaimed rules-lite system of Best Left Buried, Orbital Blues uses a simple D6 based system with 3 basic stats - MUSCLE, GRIT, and SAVVY - to handle rolls and uncertainty - putting the narrative and relationships of the player characters at the heart of play without the baggage of hefty mechanics, classes or roles. 
In addition to the three core stats, characters also have GAMBITS, and TROUBLES. Gambits are a measure of a character's special talents or unique abilities, whilst Troubles track the heartbreaks, set-backs and blues that Interstellar Outlaws gather around them on their adventures in a difficult universe.  With these simple values and a wealth of gambits and troubles in the core book, players can build a wide variety of unique, storied characters to explore the Frontier Galaxy. 
Working together, Crews generate a scrappy ship to call home, and must balance their Credits & Debts  in order to stay afloat. Whether it's knowing how they'll pay for a bowl of bell peppers and beef, or where they'll find another clip for their 9mm, the session-by-session play of Orbital Blues is driven by  the rollercoaster lives of Interstellar Outlaws and the work they have to constantly seek out.
Whether it's hauling salvage across back-water systems or getting boots on the ground sniffing out the Frontier Galaxy's most dangerous bounties, the core book of Orbital Blues is brimming with generators, adventure hooks, play prompts and even a sand-box setting for storytellers to get memorable campaigns going, whilst player characters contend with their own interpersonal relationships and troubles. 

Orbital Blues is a 120-Page Trade 6"x9"Hardback Book,  with writing and creative direction from Sam Sleney and Zachary Cox, furnished with stunning art from Josh Clark and layout work from Lone Archivist. Edited by Jared Sinclair, Orbital Blues is tight, stylish roleplaying package for all your lo-fi, sci-fi needs. 
We're printing Orbital Blues with two alternative covers; the standard Day cover, saturated with the big blue sky and the desert dust,  and a Kickstarter-exclusive night-mode cover for those who like to keep their book collections subtle and sophisticated. 
Day Cover
*WIP - As a Kickstarter Exclusive we really want this one to shine...
We use a size slightly larger than A5, Trade (6" x 9") across all of our books, to help us stuff more goodness into each page. The hardcover books are planned to be offset, allowing us to feature higher-quality paper, smyth-sewn bindings and all kinds of bells, whistles and ribbons with additional funding.
The internals of the book are being beautifully laid out by Lone Archivist, incorporating art, text and tables seamlessly into visually stunning and easy to navigate pages and spreads.
Spread pages from Crew Ship Generation.
A spread from The Sutler System, a sandbox adventure included in the core book.
As for shipping physical books,  US Distribution will be handled via Exalted Funeral, and the UK & RoW distribution will be handled in house by the SoulMuppet Publishing team. If the campaign is successful and exceeds expectations, we've got specialist fulfilment contractors in place to help fulfil and navigate shipping.
 For backers who pledge for the PDF version, we’ve successfully distributed files via DriveThruRPG and Kickstarter previously and are confident we can do it again.

This campaign aims to fulfil orders for a print-run of Orbital Blues. At the time of writing, the manuscript is finished, gone through extensive playtesting with a public playtest beta, and is currently being laid out - we're just looking to get it finalised and printed in the quality it deserves, and into your hands. We have pledges for the core book at .PDF and Physical Hardback tiers to deliver on this plan.  
Followers of SoulMuppet Publishing know the work and care that's been put into our flagship game, Best Left Buried. With Orbital Blues, we're looking to do the same for sci-fi roleplaying as we did for dark fantasy roleplaying with BLB. We want to make a modern, robust,  and affordable game with a lifetime of support and releases.  Once this Kickstarter funds, we'll immediately start enacting plans to give this game the same longevity, support and accessibility that Best Left Buried enjoys.
To stay true to the vintage music roots that inspired the game, we've also collaborated with musician and tabletop writer Chris Bissette to create a  cassette tape LP of music from the universe of Orbital Blues, with Chris performing as the fictional band The Deltas. The tape comes beautifully packaged in a crimson red rave case with an small adventure on the case insert. You can pick the tape up with your book in our Bounty Hunter pledge.
If you're eager to dive into our visions and the sounds of Orbital Blues, Creative Director Sam has compiled a living playlist of music, containing tracks and artists that inspired the writing, creation and atmosphere of Orbital Blues.
 Music has been a huge influence in the writing of Orbital Blues, and Sam has curated this playlist to reflect the sounds and styles that have imbued the project with so much life. We have no affiliation with any of the artists in this playlist (though if anyone knows anyone, hook us up... - S) and it's purely a curation of tracks that inspired the making of the book. You can listen and follow on spotify here, and you can expect updates to the playlist whenever we have pen to paper in the future.

With Orbital Blues already sitting pretty as a completed product, and now funded, the only way is up. We're looking to support Orbital Blues as a flagship game here at SoulMuppet Publishing, and we know the best way to do that is with more adventures and expansions to the core book. Along with additional art and higher production values, each incremental amount raised for this campaign after we hit goal will fund further material from guest writers. Depending on how far we go after funding, we'll also look at adding additional tiers with extra merch. Keep an eye on the tracker below!
Onwards and upwards, and as we approach the final 24 hours of this campaign, we're setting our sights on one last stretch goal - an upgrade to the cassettes that so many of you have pledged for. How much can you upgrade a 60 year-old storage medium, we hear you wonder. Well, at 700% funding we'll be;
Adding Limited Edition Orbital Blues Guitar Picks to each Cassette
Putting more content on the inlays
Adding an A6 Tri-fold Scenario to every Cassette
We're looking into ensuring the Cassettes are of the highest quality, so even if you don't have a tape player, they will still make for stylish display pieces in their own right. Currently we're looking at BandCDs to fulfil the cassette prints, and you can see a portfolio of their work below - we're confident the Orbital Blues Cassette will be a gorgeous compliment to an already stunning game.

Upon reaching £60,000, we're proud to announce we'll be putting this additional funding towards adding the talented Basheer Ghouse to our roster of contributing writers on Orbital Blues, with one last job...
 The job was simple. Run the briefcase to the Rock of Tariq, make sure no-one opens it, and get the sort of pay-out that crews retire on. The journey wasn't exactly safe, but for that sort of money, who cares?
Yet when you arrived at the Rock, you found your employer dead and no-one able to pay you.
Now half a dozen factions want the cargo, and most of them are willing to kill to get it. Now you're in a race against time. Figure out what's going on, offload your cargo, and get out of there. Or else you'll join the growing list of bodies on the infamous Rock of Tariq.
Basheer  (@BasheerGhouse) is a writer and cultural consultant based out of San Jose, California. In addition to work for companies like Kobold Press and Rowan, Rook, and Deckard, he's independently published RPGs that range from absurdist comedy to collaborative horror. His contributions can be found in products like Alien Archive 4, Warlock Grimoire 2, and Spire: Shadow Operations, and his personal work can be found at his itch.io page.
For us, Basheer is delivering a pulp pressure cooker of an adventure, where Interstellar Outlaw Crews will find themselves pitted against dangerous opponents in a high-risk, high-stakes, and high-reward play of intrigue and action.
In reaching 50k, we're confident in announcing that a set 4 Orbital Blues dice will now be included with all Interstellar Kingpin pledges. This will not increase the price on that pledge.
We'll have some proofs of the dice with us within the week, but rest assured, they're just as glossy and polished as the rest of the project.
If you want to pick up these dice outside of the Interstellar Kingpin pledge, they'll be available in the post-campaign pledge manager for add-ons.
Upon hitting £45,000 in funding, we've added Giuliano Roverato (@KnightRamen) to our ever-growing team of contributing writers! Giuliano is a Brazilian narrative designer that lives for good food, tough choices and exploring weird dungeons forgotten on the corners of our reality. Best known for the culinary adventure, Bakto’s Terrifying Cuisine, he is wondering if the post-fantasy RPG Brave Zenith will ever see the light of day. Oh, and he really wants to write a bossanova inspired adventure for Orbital Blues too, so let's hear about what he has in store for us!
"I want to see the golden shores of my old home, feel its warm sands on my feet, hear the bittersweet melodies, the ones sang to me in bedtime stories by sobbing workers. Day and night the people of Tradis station toil away, forced to clean the planet-side wasteland that the corp calls the “future of living.”
We are tired, angry and dying. We have nostalgia for a home that is unknown to us. This is not a strike. This a call for help. Bring us home, outlaws. Chega de Saudade."

In Giuliano's stirring exploration of themes of home, nostalgia, place and being, Interstellar Outlaw Crews will visit Tradis station and discover the meaning of Saudade, know the plight of its workers, and be tempted by corporate money beyond their wildest dreams. Here, you can’t save everyone.

Thought-provoking and emotive, Giuliano's pitch is one we're incredibly excited for, and we're thrilled to have him onboard.
 Music is a key part of Orbital Blues, and we want to make sure that comes across in a full and proper way. At 400% funding, we've commissioned Chris to further extend the EP Cassette by a third, adding 3 all-new, original tracks to the runtime on both the cassette itself, and in the MP3 collection. These tracks will be perfect for use as background in your games, as atmospheric cornerstones or rip-roaring soundtracks to the adventures of Interstellar Outlaws.
At £35,000, we added the work of Tom Mecredy to Orbital Blues' roster of adventures, providing an open, sandbox-styled storyteller's toolkit adventure for your games of Orbital Blues.
Placeholder!
 You'll have seen Hagstrom's glossy ads, with their smiling, weather-beaten workers mopping their brows, or relaxing in sleek habitation units, surrounded by their enthusiastic families. You'll have also heard the rumours that Hagstrom's workers are actually indentured to the company, forced to pay off their passage with hard graft. Wollaston's Hold is only a jump away - spool up the drive, and find out the truth.
All That Glitters pitches your outlaws into a system full of trouble - a corporate cold war is about to turn hot, revolutionary workers are amassing arms to throw off their oppressive masters, and an ambitious pirate queen is looking to pull off an audacious bullion heist. Keep a hand on your gun, don't trust anyone, and you might just make it out in one piece.

Tom Mecredy (@TomMecredy) is a writer and game designer based in the north of England, drawing upon his passion for history and Cold War espionage thrillers to weave tangled conspiracies and revolutions across the stars.  Tom's recent work includes High Speed Low Drag, an introspective, solo-play experience about going to war and the effects it has on soldiers, and Condotto, a Forged in the Dark game about running a company of mercenaries in 14th century Italy.
All That Glitters adds a true sandbox experience to Orbital Blues' adventure roster, with a variety of Factions, NPCs and jobs for crews to engage with - it's a style of play that fans of games such as Blades in the Dark will be familiar with, and we're super excited to see it added it to the ever-growing library of supplemental content storytellers can utilise for Orbital Blues.
Upon reaching £30,000, we added Momatoes to our writing team! Momatoes (@momatoes) is a Filipina game and graphic designer who has written RPGs about memory, legacy, and the dear price wizards pay for their ambition. Her biggest project, ARC, is a rules-light, tension-heavy RPG that’s coming to Kickstarter in 2021 and is one of Dicebreaker’s “must-play” upcoming RPGs. For her stretch goal, Momatoes plans on writing a confounding yet compelling mystery wrapped around a deeply human heart. Not a literal heart, though… unless…? 
Placeholder!
 Alexin Arius was a pioneer, an eccentric inventor who built wondrous automatons and augments. Now, decades after their disappearance, a desperate sheriff hires a crew of Interstellar Outlaws for what looks to be a straightforward bounty: track Alexin in a promising new location, the long-forgotten Everjoy space station and amusement park.
But not all is what it seems, and the supposedly abandoned Everjoy is steeped in endless mystery. Rust and decay run rampant - but why does the jingle still play over the stale air? No customer had set foot in its towering rides or souvenir shops for years - but why do the animatronic mascots still greet you with a smile? And the wide-eyed children who watch you from edges and corners - who are they, and what secrets lurk in the utopia they’ve built?
Visit Everjoy now, where the good times must never end.

Momatoes' EVERJOY adventure will now be available in .PDF, and will be distributed, fully illustrated, along with Sinta Posadas' A STARBORN RESISTANCE, once the core book has shipped, ensuring that everyone will have a nice shiny core book to run their adventures with! We can't wait to see what Momatoes has in store for us, and what else the future may bring for Orbital Blues!
We've received nothing but kind words and praise for our art direction, so as such we're taking the leap to collect all the creative energies that have made this project a reality, with Wayward Stars: The Art of Orbital Blues. A coffee table art book in miniature (we're looking at 6" x 9" A5 horizontal) Wayward Stars will delve into the artistic process, world-building and step-by-step explorations of how a tabletop game's art is made, with words from Josh Clark.
Placeholder!
A deep-dive into the worldbuilding of Orbital Blues.
Wayward Stars will be available as an add-on, or available in the WAYWARD STAR, SPACE COWBOY 2 or INTERSTELLAR KINGPIN pledge levels, and physical copies of Wayward Stars will ship alongside core books in August 2021.
Postcards from the Frontier Galaxy were our first stretch goal,  available from £15,000. These will be included free at all pledges levels of Space Cowboy and above. We're polling 12 pieces of art to decide 3 final pieces, and Bounty Hunter pledges will receive a collection of all 3. Interstellar Outlaw pledges will get 2 of the postcards, and Space Cowboy pledges will receive one.  These Print Postcards will add no additional costs to pledges or shipping. 
At £20,000 we added the talented Sinta Posadas to our writing team! Sin Posadas (@diwataMANILA) is a game designer and illustrator obsessed with the galaxy and all of its possible tragedies that lie in wait, just out of reach. 
Sin has pitched us an adventure called A STARBORN RESISTANCE, which we'll be releasing in .PDF form.
Placeholder Cover.
Varis X-0 was once a gleaming jewel in the crown of the Wings of Valor Confederacy. The Confederacy constructed "Harvester Homes" of the Scintilla Commune, a string of asteroid belts fitted onto an intra-atmospheric nuclear power harvester, home to any colonist willing to risk their necks for the promise of cheap lodging and a regular wage.  
After a cheaper extraction method was found a few million light years away, the Confederacy abandoned the system, leaving the Harvester Homes to rust. These days, it's just a few Interstellar Outlaws trying to keep the place afloat: salvaging equipment, finding food and power, fighting off bandits and worse. In this delapidated backwater, communities need help to keep things afloat. But what happens when a representative of the Confederacy returns, promising to restore glory to the Scintilla? At what cost? To what end for the Confederacy? And what's in it for you?

Upon reaching £20,000 in funding, A Starborn Resistance began development, and will release as a .PDF adventure shortly after the release of the physical Orbital Blues core rulebook in August 2021. Should we reach levels of funding to commission a several contributing writers, we'll compile their works into a compilation for physical release later in the year.

Orbital Blues is a SoulMuppet Publishing Production, but it has been brought about by a crack-team of independent talent to make something fresh & exciting. Here's the run-down on who's who.

Sam Sleney (@samsleney) is a freelance writer, and Creative Director for First Falling Leaf Publishing. Orbital Blues is Sam's manuscript and creative vision, born out of a lifetime love of space westerns, and being raised on the records of Bruce Springsteen in lieu of a father figure.  Together with artistic realisations from Josh Clark and the mechanical mind of Zachary Cox, Sam has fused the team's talent into the Interstellar Blues Explosion that is Orbital Blues. 

Josh Clark (@tinywoodsman) is an artist and creator who has worked on everything from album covers to business cards and video games to podcast art. His work can be seen in First Falling Leaf's "Sins: Dead City ", From Sorrow To Serenity's "Trifecta EP Project" and in the worldbuilding booklet "The Quiet Future". He can be found at TinyWoodsman. As our lead artist, Josh brought the world & creative vision of Orbital Blues to life from the Day 1, and made the project what it is today. 

Zachary Cox (@JellyMuppet) is the Managing Partner of SoulMuppet Publishing, dabbling in everything from printing, distribution, management and social media. The original creator of Best Left Buried, Zach has contributed to the mechanical writing and masterminded improvements on Best Left Buried's engine for Orbital Blues, adapting the original SRD and mechanics to perfectly accompany lo-fi, space western roleplay.
Jared Sinclair (@infinite_mao) is an editor and sometime writer of games and games-related material. His work as a writer includes Anti-Sisyphus, What's So Cool About Outer Space?, Prismot!, and The Vanilla Game. He also runs Spear Witch, an independent online bookstore specializing in small-creator game books and zines. As our editor, Jared cut the manuscript of Orbital Blues into shape, making it into a lean, cohesive and accessible book that cuts right to the heart of thematic play. 

Lone Archivist (@LoneArchivist) is a game and graphic designer based out of Southern California. His work includes writing and design for a handful of third-party modules for games such as Mothership and Best Left Buried as well as several self-published system-agnostic game supplements. When not working on games he can be found crate-digging for a new Jazz record or adding yet another book to the TBR list. Lone is currently hard at working coalescing the manuscript, art and style of Orbital Blues into a tight, stylish and striking print. 

Chris Bissette (@Pangalactic) is a Manchester-based game designer and musician. His game The Wretched - along with its original soundtrack - was selected as one of Tabletop Gaming Magazine's Best Games of 2020 and has spawned hundreds of games using its Wretched & Alone engine. Chris is performing as the fictional band The Deltas on their debut Cassette LP, Orbital Blues, which you can pick up alongside the core rulebook as a keynote piece. You can find Chris' music, games, and more at LootTheRoom. 

Sin is the designer of the Planted RPG series, a small collection of tabletop rpgs where you play as sentient plants defending your homes from evil bugs. Their other works include explorations into your deepest fears in the Deep, Deep River, fanciful food trips in Lutong Banwa, and playing out the dramatics of being agents of a Tower racing against the Apocalypse in Navathem's End. They're currently working to complete Navathem's End after it was successfully funded as part of the recently concluded #OurShores Kickstarter campaign. You can find their other melancholic games here, on their itch.io page. Sin will be writing A Starborn Resistance, an adventure for Orbital Blues achieved as a stretch goal. 

Momatoes (@momatoes) is a Filipina game and graphic designer who has written RPGs about memory, legacy, and the dear price wizards pay for their ambition. Her biggest project, ARC, is a rules-light, tension-heavy RPG that’s coming to Kickstarter in 2021 and is one of Dicebreaker’s “must-play” upcoming RPGs.  Momatoes will be writing EVERYJOY, an Orbital Blues adventure that we unlocked as a stretch goal.

Orbital Blues began life as an internal passion project, that snowballed into release through enthusiasm and available connections in lockdown. We're looking to diversify the team for Orbital Blues with immediate stretch goals for writers and contributors from a greater wealth of backgrounds than the core team, and will be adding such individuals here once we've hired them at competitive rates. If you're interested in writing for Orbital Blues, get in touch here, with writing samples, pitches or portfolios.

We've had a few people now from various parts of the world asking for more detailed shipping information so they can make an informed decision about pledging. When you take Brexit, the global pandemic and shipping delays, and add them to the fact SoulMuppet Publishing only has experience in smaller scale print-runs from calmer times, it's been hard to make estimated guesses on the prices of shipping for a project that's shaping up to be this successful. However, we've gone away, done our homework, made some enquiries and ran some numbers, and below are our current shipping estimates.
We'll update this image where it appears on the main campaign body actively whenever anything changes.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With our book already being in final stages of completion and this Kickstarter serving as a means of production, we don't have any concerns for the completion of this project. As we already navigated the fulfilments in previous campaigns such as Best Left Buried: Deeper and Stygian Library, we also don't have any concerns regarding deliveries and distributions. If anything changes with the global situation it will only serve to speed up our estimated times of delivery.

updates.update_userinfo: EASY COME, EASY GO - POSTCARDS | POLLS | SINTA POSADAS
updates.update_content:
Hey all,
After yesterday's exasperated funding update, we've had some time to rest and recalculate for what is shaping up to be a very successful campaign, and we've got some exciting announcements! Now that funding is in the rear-view mirror, the road of campaign possibilities stretches us out before us, and our foot is firmly on the gas.

Hello everyone!

For a game that was a long time in the making, it’s very humbling to see the project fund and excite so many people so quickly. This project was born out of a silly conversation about space westerns taking place too close to a conversation about roleplaying in a pub in the far-off year of 2018, and when the two met, we never thought it’d end up like this. It’s amazing to see it doing numbers like these. We don’t really know what to say other than When we’ve got some better, grander words that do the level of support we’ve received justice, we’ll spill ‘em.
