campaign.story:
New Tales of the Miskatonic Valley returns!
Lauded as authentically Lovecraftian and much loved for of its mood and style, New Tales of the Miskatonic Valley returns with a full-colour second edition. With its new art, varied formats (PDF, Kindle, softcover, and hardback), and an extra scenario, this Kickstarter will make its rightful return to print, uplifted to Call of Cthulhu, 7th Edition.
Call of Cthulhu is the Registered Trademark of Chaosium Inc., and is used with their permission. www.chaosium.com
 Miskatonic River Press released New Tales of the Miskatonic Valley to great acclaim and it quickly became a favourite among Call of Cthulhu Keepers. Its faithful adherence to Lovecraftian themes and its location along the dark river it takes its name from, meant a return to an authentic home for many players who cut their anti-mythos teeth on earlier adventures set in the valley.


Started by Keith 'Doc' Herber and Tom Lynch, it quickly marked MRP as a company to watch. Tragically, Doc passed away while working on a subsequent title (Our Ladies of Sorrow with Kevin Ross) but Tom kept his dream alive and grew upon it with further books. Sadly, MRP closed its doors a couple of years ago and the titles have been out of print as Tom Lynch focused on writing fiction and his family.

Last year, Stygian Fox purchased four titles from Tom Lynch/MRP in order to bring them back to players of the world's greatest horror game and in turn, we aim to release new and updated versions of New Tales of the Miskatonic Valley, More Adventures in Arkham Country, Our Ladies of Sorrow, and Tales of the Sleepless City.
In New Tales of the Miskatonic Valley, there are currently six scenarios and we aim to add a seventh set in the valley or Innsmouth (although Innsmouth isn't in the Miskatonic Valley it is such an integral part of Lovecraft Country as to be hard to ignore). The original is black and white and 130 pages. We aim to increase that to 160 pages and to make it full colour with all new art.
The Authors
The original scenarios will appear and be updated to 7th edition Call of Cthulhu (still fully backwards compatible with previous editions) and are works by Christopher Smith Adair (The Darkness Beneath the Hill, Children of a Starry Heaven, This Village Belongs to Us), Tom Lynch (Ties That Bind, Vinea Perversa, Lines In The Sand, Lovecraft eZine) Oscar Rios (The Nature of Faith, The Legacy of Arrius Lurco, Borne Into Darkness) 
Kevin Ross (Kingsport: The City In The Mists, The Music of the Spheres, Tell Me, Have You Seen The Yellow Sign?) 
and Doc Herber (H. P. Lovecraft's Arkham, H. P. Lovecraft's Dunwich, Escape From Innsmouth 2nd Ed., and far too many others to mention)
Their adventures are set in such diverse locations as Arkham, Foxfield, Dunwich, and Kingsport and are:
The Reeling Midnight, by Tom Lynch
Wasted Youth, by Christopher Smith Adair
Spirit of Industry, by Oscar Rios
Proof of Life, by Keith Herber
Malice Everlasting, by Oscar Rios
The Night War, by Kevin A. Ross

Production Staff
The folks behind this new version of New Tales of the Miskatonic Valley have a proven track record of bringing new Call of Cthulhu content to gamers everywhere via Kickstarter and other platforms.

Stephanie McAlea - Owner of Stygian Fox, Cartographer, and mad idea summoner (Hudson & Brand, The Things We Leave Behind, Horror On The Orient Express, Cthulhu by Gaslight 3rd ed., 2300AD, The Book of Contemporary Magical Things)

Badger McInnes - Layout Artist and Word Wizard (Secrets of San Francisco, Secrets of Kenya, Secrets of Los Angeles, Our Ladies of Sorrow, More Adventures in Arkham Country, The Things We Leave Behind, Feed The Shoggoth!)
Some of our contributions to RPG publishing
 As mentioned, the book will contain a new adventure set in the valley or nearby, the layout will be by Badger McInnes and we'd like to add further art by creators we admire and trust to deliver, including more art by Mihai Bila (shown below). This is where the Kickstarter funds come in. The book will be printed in a premium format and, as Stygian Fox customers have come to expect, will use art to portray a slightly more horrific and mature version of NTotMV. 
Mihai's Facebook page with examples of his art is here: https://m.facebook.com/mcrassusart/
The funds for this Kickstarter will go towards commissioning more art and the hiring a writer and creatives of quality to expand the book. The funds will also go on printing and distribution.
'The Festival' by Mihai Bila
Backers can look forward to lovingly produced PDFs, Softcover and Hardcover books, and increased quality and content. Apart from a few tweaks to the text in order to update the scenarios, very little of the adventures will actually change. The entire cost of your books and getting them to you is covered by your pledge.
PDF: Backers will receive a full-colour PDF of New Tales of the Miskatonic Valley via DriveThruRPG. 

Softcover: Backers will receive a full-colour standard print in softcover format of New Tales of the Miskatonic Valley via DriveThruRPG along with a free PDF. 
Hardcover: Backers will receive a full-colour premium print in hardcover format of New Tales of the Miskatonic Valley via DriveThruRPG along with a free PDF.

Hardcover + Naming: Backers will receive a full-colour premium print in hardcover format of New Tales of the Miskatonic Valley via DriveThruRPG along with a free PDF plus their chosen name and occupation done up all fancy n' such in the back of the book (we reserve the right to reject any inappropriate names or occupations).
With this project, our focus is to bring back MRP's first book back in print in a beautiful format. As it is a previously written project, there's only so much we can do in terms of stretch goals. We're already adding new art and maps but, hopefully, we can add a few other things too. If we're lucky enough to reach the top levels we'll also give a 'thank you' gratuity to the authors of the previous edition (even though it was paid for as work-for-hire) and we'll up our cents-per-word scale for the new writer and artists for helping us get there. Admittedly, this doesn't benefit our backers but as pay in the RPG industry is seriously low, I'm sure you'll want to help the creatives involved to get a bonus.
Distribution is via DriveThruRPG/RPGNow.

updates.update_content:
Hello Tubey backers!
We are extremely excited to introduce 3 new products! Tubey the Tubeman 2.0, The Tubey Family Pack, and the Tubey Color Pack!

Hello backers,
We are excited to announce that all Tubeys have been shipped! 
This project came to life because of your support and we can't thank you enough. 
If you experience any problems at all with your Tubey, please e-mail us at tudulabs@gmail.com.

Hello Backers,
Happy new year! We hope everyone's 2019 is off to a good start.
We have some good news. Our new, functioning power supplies have been shipped and we should be receiving them sometime next week! Our international fulfillment center has already received their adapters.

Hello backers,
We have better news today. We have successfully sourced and tested new usb cables/power adapters. Our manufacturer sent us about a dozen samples and they are all operating at full power and working properly.
Now that we have a new usb cable/power adapter, it will take a few weeks for the manufacturing/shipping process to take place. So we are still sitting at about 4-5 weeks behind our original fulfillment schedule. Thank you for your patience through this small roadblock.

Hello Tubey Supporters
We have good news and bad news.
The good news is that we have received all of our units from our manufacturer and have even started fulfilling our international backers.
The bad news is that after further tests, we’ve realized that some of the usb cables we have provided are faulty. This isn’t a huge obstacle as the actual Tubey unit is fully functional. We are working quickly to source a new power cable, and already have a few solutions. But what this does mean is that our fulfillment has halted and will most likely be delayed by one month.

Hello backers!
Just a quick update from us. We should have our first production sample complete in just a few more weeks. Our manufacturing partners have been sharing their progress every step of the way and things are looking great!
Thanks for your support every step of the way!

Hello Backers,
Our production underway! We could not be more excited to finally bring Tubey to life! So far, we are still running according to our proposed timeline. You can expect your mini wacky wavy inflatable flailing arm tube man, Tubey, to be shipped early December. Woo hoo!
We will be sending out shipping surveys to collect your shipping information once production is wrapping up.

campaign.story:
Humanity's first step beyond the Sol system might be its last.
Siren's Call is a campaign and sourcebook for the Shadows Over Sol roleplaying game. It follows the story of the ARC Project, humanity's first ever attempt to build and launch an interstellar colony ship.
The ARC Project is one of the most ambitious endeavors ever undertaken. If successful, it will transport some 10,000 colonists the 4.4 light years from Sol to the planet Siren, orbiting Alpha Centauri A.
The journey will take 400 years, with all passengers and crew in stasis. No one knows exactly what will be found on the other side — what challenges and horrors the colonists will face as they make a life on this new world.
Siren's Call is inspired by a variety of science fiction media, ranging from Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri and James S. A. Corey’s excellent The Expanse series, to Ridley Scott’s classic film Alien and Kim Stanley Robinson's Mars trilogy.
The Siren's Call campaign and sourcebook will be a full-color hardback volume estimated at 240 pages. It includes:
A flexible campaign consisting of eight core scenarios, plus numerous optional "side trek" adventures and ample room for GM-created personal plots.
Complete details on the ARC Project and the Alpha Centauri system, with plenty of insight and plot hooks for other interstellar colonization adventures.
Descriptions, ecological details and stat blocks for numerous exoplanetary lifeforms, enigmatic machines, human archetypes and individual characters.
A new system for colony building, societal planning, advancement and mass combat. What type of society will you create?
Optional rules for character aging, as well as how to handle wealth and lifestyle in the colony.
New interstellar colonization-related gear, vehicles and genelines!
“Great setting with a ton of awesome info and backstory and cool art...”
—Jack M., DriveThruRPG
Two hundred years from now what should be the shining beacon of the future is instead cloaked in conspiracy and horror. Humankind has expanded throughout the solar system, and there it has discovered mysteries older than humanity.
The culture has shattered into myriad subcultures; nation-states are the hollow shells of what they once were. Corporations and other groups wage small-scale wars in the streets or in space. Bioengineered horrors left over from these conflicts stalk the hulls of ruined stations and abandoned colonies.
But for an enterprising team willing to brave the horrors, there's always a profit to be made.
The Shadows Over Sol core rulebook was first published in 2016. Since then, seven adventures, three supplements and four accessories have been published for the game line. Siren's Call will be the largest and most ambitious to date!
Once the initial funding goal has been reached, additional stretch goals will be unveiled. These goals may either be unlocked at specified funding levels, or at a specific number of patrons for Tab Creations' accompanying Patreon project. The conditions for unlocking each goal will be specified in its description.
UNLOCKED! - Siren Poster Map - $2000: Our first stretch goal unlocks a world map of Siren, the planet to be colonized by the ARC Project. This will be made available in print as a poster map, and digitally in a high resolution image format. The electronic version and an "at cost" code for the print version will be included in all reward tiers at THE GAME and up.
UNLOCKED! - Player's Brief - $3000: The Siren's Call Player's Brief will be a full color PDF document containing all of the player-facing information and options from the Siren's Call campaign and sourcebook. “Love the Saga Machine system... Going to adapt the system to other RPGs!”
—James C., DriveThruRPG
Siren's Call for Shadows Over Sol combines the wonder and mystery of science fiction with the intensity and danger of the horror genre. The core system, Saga Machine, has been in use for a decade, including publication in our other roleplaying games, Against the Dark Yogi and Dime Adventures. This version of the rules was published in 2016 and has received widespread praise. We have 4.9/5 stars on DriveThruRPG!
Gameplay highlights from the core rulebook include:
Support for a wide range of science fiction themes and tones.
Campaign options specifically designed to adapt to different levels of horror. Easily dial your game down to survival horror or up to action horror!
An engineering system for inventing or improving upon existing technology.
A hacking system designed to engage all members of the party. No longer are the rest of your players going to sit and wait for one player to finish the hacking minigame!
A combat system designed for tense and deadly confrontations.
A wide selection of gear and bioengineered monstrosities to terrify your players!
Want to know more?
All backers can access the complete draft text of Siren's Call today! Simply follow the link from the first backer-only update!
Siren's Call has been in development in some form since the release of the Shadows Over Sol core rulebook in 2016. The concept has gone through multiple iterations and the campaign has received three rounds of playtests. The text has been written, we have some great art in the works and we can't wait to share this project with the world!
Shadows Over Sol has seen development and play as a homebrew setting since 2009, and this incarnation of the rules is the result of over two years of development and public playtests.
As with our previous projects, we will again be Kicking it Forward!

updates.update_userinfo: Physical Rewards are Beginning to Ship
updates.update_content:
Our distribution partner, Studio 2, now has everything they need to begin sending out the physical rewards. The first shipments are being packaged up and should be transferred to the post office later today or tomorrow.
Rewards for backers at THE GAME tier are being sent out first, as they involve the fewest components. Over the next few days this will be followed by rewards for backers at THE GAME PLUS tier.

Shipping Addresses for Siren's Call will be frozen this Thursday, September 20th. If you need to change your address, or don't know what your address will be, send us a Kickstarter message ASAP letting us know so that we can get the details corrected.
Now that the most important piece of information is out of the way, let's move on to the rest of the update.
The Shipping Update

It's time for the August update on Siren's Call. While we don't have a bunch of news at the moment, we feel it's important to keep all of our backers informed on the game's progress.
First off, the final digital reward, The Nereus Incident, was sent out two weeks ago. This means that all backers should have received all of their digital rewards by now. If you're missing a digital reward, let us know and we will make sure it gets to you.

Welcome to the monthly Siren's Call update for July! It's been a good month, but there's not a lot of new information, so this should be a comparatively short post. Let's begin!
The physical books for Siren's Call are currently at the printers. We had to review two rounds of printing proofs for the final book, but a little over a week ago we gave the printers the green light to do the full offset print run. Once the print run is complete, the books will be shipped to our fulfillment partner's warehouse. We expect to have more details on this in next month's update.

Hello Siren's Call backers! It's been an amazing month!
Earlier in June we released Siren's Call in PDF and then sent out a corrected version with all reported typos fixed. We have also released the revised Quick-Start, the colony sheets, Pregenerated Colonists and the ARC colony ship deckplans.
Yesterday we sent the files to the printer! This is good news for all print backers, as it starts the ball rolling for the game's physical production.

Good news, everyone! This morning we released the Siren's Call PDF!
Backers at THE GAME tier and up should receive an email from DriveThruRPG with a link to download the book. If you haven't received the link by tomorrow morning, message us and we will resolve the issue.
Found a typo or other error?

We've made great progress on Siren's Call in the past month! If you've been following along with our weekly social media updates, you already know everything we've been up these past few weeks (see Week 1, 2, 3, 4 , 5, 6).
With any luck, you'll have the initial PDF of the book in your hands by the end of June. We'll then collect reports of typos or other issues that slipped through production, and then release a corrected PDF a couple weeks later. This corrected file is the one that will be sent to the printer (more on that below).

campaign.story:
From the desk of Henry Armitage
 Welcome to our second Kickstarter! 
After the success of our first Kickstarter, we decided to go all out and bring to you four, hardcover, leather bound and embossed, mythos based journals, for Cthulhu Investigators and Keepers.
Edit: We've been ask by a few backers where they can get the leather document wallet from the first Kickstarter and featured right here on these pages.
Leather Document Wallet - Elder Sign
You can check them out here - LINK
Edit finished: back to the task in hand...
Inspired by Lovecraft
Designed to enhance your gaming experience, the journals are inspired by the works of Lovecraft himself. Three journals themed around At the Mountains of Madness, The Call of Cthulhu and The Dunwich Horror. The fourth is a Mythos Flora and Fauna journal documenting an investigators descent into madness. 
At 8 x 5 inches and with 200 pages of quality notepaper inside, they are the perfect size to be used in game for note taking or to map out your Call of Cthulhu campaigns. 
The four journals will come in two brown and two black leather hardcovers and each will have it's own embossing art. 
Below we have also included the Masks of Nyarlathotep emboss art. Join the Carlyle expedition.
Embossing Art
At the Mountains of Madness will will sport the "Antarctic Expedition" motif as seen in the picture above
The Call of Cthulhu will have embossed on it The Stars Align symbol
The Dunwich Horror will show The MU Letterhead sigil.
The Flora and Fauna journal will have The MU Botanical Society symbol.
The journals evoke the feeling of discovering an artefact full of esoteric script or hidden clues, but this time, you are the dread author. 
First Edition
Featuring exclusive art from the talented HP Lovecraft Historical Society, including some never seen in print before , these hard cover, leather bound journals will transport you back in time to the desk of Henry Armitage himself.
PLAY

Why We Chose Journals 
We wanted each journal to emulate those found during games and in Lovecraft's own stories. To give investigators a chance to tell their own stories, to document their own descent into madness. Perhaps, later to be found and read by others. I can think of nothing that would excite me more than a player showing me their journal after a long campaign, filled with madness, clues and strange events. Personal, unique, exciting. 
The Investigation Continues
The Flora and Fauna journal features original artwork by talented artist, Seth Laster. Inspired by Victorian era Flora and Fauna books, with a distinctly mythos twist. 
"Clutching your journal, sketching into it the madness you dare not acknowledge, you know that you are coming to the end. Soon you will turn the last page and you must sketch your final piece. A self portrait. What have you become?”
Every investigators nightmare...
Shoggoth Draft Sketch
Star Vampire Draft Sketch
 ...and that is where it gets really good. 
Journals for Your Campaigns
Chaosium has asked us to make a series of Campaign Journals for their existing and future Call of Cthulhu games, including the up coming release of Masks of Nyarlethotep. WHICH WE ARE VERY EXCITED ABOUT ARGGHHGHH!
Sorry, just a bout of temporary insanity there. 
In fact, if we hit our targets we will get to work straight away on a MoN journal, which, may even get added here, as an add on, in time for the launch of Masks.
New Masks - Art by Sam Johnson
Exclusive Backer Rewards 
But you don't want to know all that, you want to know what exclusive Kickstarter content we have on offer. 
We are going to produce exclusive Flora and Fauna postcards with art not used in the journal that wont ever be seen anywhere else. There will also be an exclusive challenge coin for backers only. 
Exclusive Backer Challenge Coin
Limited Edition Hardcover Slipcase sets. 
To really kick it up a notch we are offering Limited Edition slipcase sets signed by Servitor of the Outer Gods himself , Mike Mason. 
Each set will contain one of each journal. Embossed on the front and safely tucked inside a protective slipcase. Each will come with a signed certificate of authenticity. Numbered and sealed.
We will produce only 100 of these. 
A true collectors piece.
Ltd Edition Slipcase Set - Artists Render
Which Brings us to Stretch Goals 
We unlocked a secret compartment and found...  
I have just returned from the printers after spending the morning talking about physical ephemera and printing.  
Why was I there?  
I was there because you hit our first stretch goal and I got excited. We have been pouring over the assets from the HP Lovecraft Historical Society and taking some expert advice from them and the printers and think we have picked out some winners.  
So, we will be including some physical ephemera in each journal. From the vast HPLHS library of assets we have chosen some of our favorites.
HPLHS Ephemera
But, don't take my word for it, here is a message from Andrew Leman himself. 
PLAY

The second stretch goal we want to offer is the inclusion of a fountain pen. To scribe all your insane writings with and accompany you on your investigations.  
Sample Image Only
As our third and final stretch goal, we would like to give everyone an A4 colour botanical print of one of Seth Laster's terrifyingly beautiful Mythos Flora and Fauna imaginings.
Stretch Goals
Add Ons
We are excited to announce that we will be offering our official Masks of Nyarlathotep Campaign Journal as an add on. The Masks journal will be available to backers at the Expedition Member and higher. 
Add Ons
Masks Journal
We have been asks for some details about the Masks Journal. 
The Masks journal will contain NO spoilers from the campaign. 
Join the original 1919 Carlyle expedition. We wanted the journal to be 100% use-able during your campaign of Masks and not compromise your enjoyment. So, the journal is designed from the perspective of the original Carlyle expedition. Fill it with your story and enjoy the immersive ephemera printed within. 
The Masks Journal will be available as an add on for Expedition Member and higher levels. 
Masks 2018 Edition
Kickstarter Schedule 
Kickstarter Schedule
 What happens next? 
We are ready to go. We have the prototypes made, the patterns for the leather, the test molds for the coins, the artwork is done and all the design work is finished. All we need is your support.
Shipping
Shipping Friendly
 All shipping costs will be calculated and added to your pledge after the campaign is successful. We will be shipping worldwide and have estimated amount to give some indication so there are no horrible surprises. 
Estimated Shipping Costs
Call of Cthulhu and Chaosium   
A huge thank you has to go to the team at Chaosium for their support and help in bringing this Kickstarter to you. May your POW match theirs and never be overcome.
Call of Cthulhu is a Registered Trademark of Chaosium Inc., and is used with their permission www.chaosium.com  
The names, descriptions, and depictions applied to this product are derived from works copyrighted by and include trademarks owned by Chaosium Inc., and may not be used or reused without its permission.
HP Lovecraft Historical Society
The talented people at the HPLHS have made beautiful prop documents for decades along side their Dark Adventure Radio Theatre and you can find them at www.hplhs.org 
Thank you so much, we look forward to working with you again in the future. 
HP Lovecraft - What can we say?
Thank you for years of horror inspired gaming
The Man , The Myth , The Horror
TYPE40

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We understand that every project comes with risk and we have already made steps to mitigate them where possible.

Risks we have already identified include:

Material supply.

Although the supply or leather is reliable, there can be issues around quantity. It is possible that an overly successful campaign would create the need for higher volumes of leather required from suppliers than normal. This would put a strain on supply and thus a strain on production. The consequence would be a delayed delivery schedule. However, we would know about that well in advance of the beginning of production and be able to communicate that to backers.

Production time.

The time taken to make the journals and the stretch goals, particularly the ephemera is not inconsiderable. That time cannot be effectively reduced without compromising quality, which is not an option. Again, an overly successful campaign may put stress upon production. This can be managed internally here at TYPE40. We have specifically put aside time in our work schedule to dedicate to this kickstarter if it should be successful.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi there everyone,
We have traveled the world over the last twelve months and met many wonderful people who have been using their Campaign Journals.
The most common refrain is that they are “too beautiful to write in”.
We urge you, write in them, you will feel better 😀 They are designed to be used and loved and filled with arcane lore.

You made it possible for us to launch a range of Call of Cthulhu Campaign Journals
A year later and those journals are out there in the wild, filling up with investigators mad ramblings and living their best life
We are so happy with all the stories we’ve heard from people who are using them, the games they are playing and all the stories people are creating.

TLDNR : Thank you. Journals are well liked. Chaosium like them a lot.  We address shipping and duty costs. The next Kickstarter. GenCon. Twitch Streaming. Will we do more journals? Suggestions. Thank you again. 
Hello to everyone and happy new year,
I wanted to send out a last update for the Call of Cthulhu Campaign Journals before we put a lid on it and close things off.

Hey everyone,
A few people have asked what kind of ink they should use with their fountain pen.
The pen itself comes with a suction converter. This means that you can buy a bottle of ink and fill your pen directly from the bottle. You can buy ink in bottles from any good stationary store.

Everything is Spooky
On this all hallows eve, may your apples be bobbed and all your tricks turn to treats.
Here is a shipping report...

We are super pleased to see that journals have started arriving with people and are very encouraged by your responses
Please let us know as you get them because we love hearing from you all.
A huge thank you to everyone, we can’t wait to see what you fill your journals with.

You may be happy to hear that all the pledges are picked and packed.
It’s all ready to go and the first of the pledges have left the door.
We are now just waiting on the courier to lodge everything and get it out to you in Kickstarter Land.
In other news, we will be at PAXAUS this weekend with Chaosium doing fun convention things, like spending too much money on expensive convention food, standing up for 12 hours at a time and exhausting ourselves and calling it fun. 🤣

campaign.story:
Here's your chance to get a collection of more than 218 full-color, full-page (8.5" x 11") high-resolution (600 dpi) tabletop RPG maps themed for Science Fiction (including VTT-ready digital versions) for only a few cents each!
With the early completion and fulfillment of the highly successful Kickstarter campaign for the first volume of The Big Book of Maps for Tabletop Roleplaying Games, Justin Andrew Mason gears up for his second volume in the cartography series!
Need a stash of high-quality full-color futuristic maps for the adventures you are writing?
Want ready-to-use collection of over 218 maps to utilize on-the-fly when player characters take an unexpected turn?
Each map has a VTT-ready version and two non-VTT versions (Player version and GM version).
All maps are in high-resolution digital format perfect for importing into your favorite Virtual Tabletop (VTT) platform!
All of the digital maps make beautiful poster-size print maps scaled for use with tabletop miniatures.
Labels on the maps are language-ambiguous (numbers and single letters only), making the entire map collection useful no matter the native language of users.
The Big Book of Maps for Tabletop Roleplaying Games - Volume 2: Science Fiction is a cartography collection of more than 218 full-color tabletop role-playing game maps that is being created by Justin Andrew Mason. These maps are being created on a twice-weekly basis throughout the creation phase of the project (April 2018 - March 2019).
Each map will be provided to those who pledge $20 (or more) in digital format (JPG) for integration into any tabletop RPG with alternate virtual tabletop (VTT) versions provided simultaneously with each map release.
Most maps will be geared towards a futuristic setting, though a few will likely have potential of crossing genres. The focus of this collection will be various science fiction locales such as space stations, planetary outposts, asteroid mining colonies, futuristic cities, science labs, spaceship deck plans, alien locations, and interplanetary waypoints, but will also include offerings for subgenres such as cyberpunk, science fantasy, and neo-noir.
There are several rewards available with content to be delivered to backers at every pledge level!
Try it out! Click Here for a free download of Starship Builder Kit #1!
Note: Due to backer request, the add-on options from the Volume 1 kickstarter are available for the original add-on price ($7 each). If you want either, just increase your pledge to cover them.
How do I increase my pledge for add-ons?
Increasing your pledge is easy. All you have to do is click on the "Manage your pledge" button located at the top of this page. Then click on the "Change your pledge" button on the bottom of the next page. There you will be able to change your "Pledge Amount" and then click on the "Continue" button to confirm.
Check back during the Kickstarter campaign as additional sample maps will be released every week!
Start benefiting from your pledge almost immediately! Rather than waiting until the entire project is completed to release content, all of the maps created for this collection will be released to backers who pledge $20 (or more) on a continuing basis via a planned schedule of two maps per week throughout the project creation phase.
The first of the maps will be provided to applicable backers tarting the day after the campaign funds are collected (usually about two weeks after the Kickstarter ends). Future map releases will continue with a minimum of twice-weekly updates throughout the creation phase until all the maps for the collection are completed.
Backers who pledge $20 (or more) will be provided with an URL and unique login information to a special website they can visit to access and download the most recently released maps and all previously released maps for this project.
Screenshot of the Digtial Distribution Tool (DDT) website.
A finished book including all of the non-VTT "Gamemaster" and "Player" versions of the maps will be provided as an indexed PDF to all backers who pledge at the $10 (or higher) pledge levels. The estimated PDF release date is around April 2019.
Backers at the $20 (or higher) pledge levels will also have the option to buy either hardcover or softcover print copies of the book at the price of production cost + shipping cost when the print version is released to the general public later in 2019. The estimated print release date is planned to be around April-June 2019. More info on pricing for print copies will be provided nearer to the project completion.
Shipping Costs for Print Book Purchases:
The print versions will be distributed as print-on-demand via DriveThruRPG.com. Domestic and international shipping charges will be handled on their end with purchase of any print copy of the book.
Volume 1: Fantasy Adventure was released in hardcover print last week. The following video is a 2-minute flip-thru of the book. We are trending steadily towards Volume 2: Science Fiction being just as huge!
PLAY

Every digital map in Volume 2 is created at 600 dpi resolution.
All of the digital maps scale up as crisp-and-clear print at poster size. This includes printing at the 1-inch scale popular for use with tabletop miniatures.
This project is not producing any physical poster map prints.
Check out the demo video below from the Volume 1 Kickstarter to see a sample map printed on premium glossy laminated paper.
PLAY

For more information on the poster-print quality digital maps, check out this update from the Volume 1 Kickstarter that explains it in more detail.
Who is Justin Andrew Mason? I am a professional tabletop role-playing game designer, ENnie Award-winning author (Adventureaweek.com Blog 2014), graphic designer, and professional cartographer (AAW MapMaster 2014 winner).
I am also the creator and cartographer of the first volume of this series, The Big Book of Maps for Tabletop Roleplaying Games - Volume 1: Fantasy Adventure.
That Kickstarter funded with over 1,000 backers raising $24K, and (with unlocked stretch goals) produced 230+ maps, 650+ map icons. It was completed more two months early and fulfilled to all backers months ahead of schedule.
Watch this project's intro video at the top of the page for a slideshow with several hundred examples of my cartography.
My various works have been published and commissioned by multiple game publishers and game-related companies including AAW Games (Into the Wintery Gale, Rise of the Drow, Snow White, Aventyr Bestiary, Underworld Races & Classes, and the Mini-Dungeon Tome), AetherCon Online Gaming Convention, EN Publishing (EN5ider; Friend of the Children, The Mystery of Mordecai's Monster, and Dia de los Dinosaurios Muertos), Dark Naga Adventures (Confronting Hastur, The City of Talos), Kobold Press (Southlands, Advanced Races Compendium, Tome of Beasts, Book of Lairs, Demon Cults, Midgard Campaign Setting, New Paths Compendium, and Creature Codex Kickstarters), Legendary Games (Hypercorps 2099), Mythoard (Adventure Hook Cards), Playground Adventures (After School Adventures), Rogue Genius Games (Veranthea Codex), and TPK Games.
I maintain a professional blog, Paths to Adventure, where anyone may keep track of my current projects, finished commissions, the latest releases of my work, and several free RPG-related web apps and generators I've developed (like the Tavern Sign Crafter). I even do a bit of self publishing through the platform as well.
What is the difference between VTT and non-VTT maps?
Backers at the $20 level (or higher) level will be provided digital access to both a VTT (Virtual Tabletop) and a non-VTT versions of every map produced for this project via the weekly releases via the Digital Distribution Tool website.
A VTT map contains no scaling grid, room numbers, icons, or hidden room contents (such as secret compartments). A non-VTT map includes  these features. The final PDF and printed book will include only the non-VTT maps.
The purpose of the VTT version of every map is provide a convenient import to Virtual Tabletop software platforms. In addition to access to the twice-weekly released downloads, at the end of the creation phase of the project all backers at the $20 (or higher) level will be provided a link to download a package (ZIP) containing both versions of every map in digital (JPG) format.
There are two non-VTT versions available of every map in this project. The "GM" version which includes numbers and labels. And the "Player" version which does not include numbers or labels. All downloadable sample maps on this page have been updated to include all three versions of the digital map for reference.
Not interested in science fiction maps? There’s still something for you here! As an incentive for folks who may not need science fiction maps for their games, I am adding in a THIRD BOOK full of all-new fantasy maps as a reward for reaching a special funding goal.
When this new Kickstarter meets or exceeds the funding met for the previous Kickstarter project ($23,562 US), I will create a third book in the Big Book of Maps series that focuses on fantasy-themed "Mini-Dungeon” maps.
When unlocked, this extra book will begin production immediately after the science fiction maps for Volume 2 are completed and released to backers.
This third collection of maps will be provided as a indexed PDF and released to all backers of this Kickstarter. Backers who pledge $20 (or more) will also get the high-resolution digital files and  VTT maps for the Mini-Dungeons, and a voucher to buy the print copy of the third book at production cost + shipping cost.
Examples of Mini-Dungeon cartography I've crafted for other publishers.
When unlocked, the third book will include over 100 fantasy mini-dungeon maps.
Whereas Volume 1 - Fantasy Adventure focused on massive maps that sometimes included as many as 70-100 rooms, this bonus book will focus on dungeon maps consisting of around 15-25 rooms each (great for those one shots, or smaller locales). It’s the perfect fantasy map companion to the first Big Book of Maps!
Note: If this special funding goal is unlocked, the Mini-Dungeon book is considered a bonus. It's completion is not tied to the estimated timeline for delivery of Volume 2. It will likely take several months after this Kickstarter has been completed and delivered to backers before the bonus book becomes available.
Licensing Note: The Stock Cartography license provided by the $295 pledge level of this Kickstarter does not extend to the 100+ Mini-Dungeon maps. If you have backed at this level, and would like to extend your license to cover the 100 extra bonus maps when it is unlocked, please increase your pledge by $50.
Every week a new Featured Addition will be added to the project. These additions are bonus material, and just my way of saying, "Thank your for all the support!" Be sure to check back every Friday during the kickstarter to see what new goodies have been added!
The Week #1 Feature Edition is Planet Portfolio 1 and Planet Portfolio 2! Originally created as a print-and-play tabletop solution, Planet Portfolio has now been updated with full VTT support! Every asset of the book has also been provided as a 300 dpi PNG image with transparent backgrounds. You can download it here for free right now!
Planet Portfolio 2 is being created as a bonus for this kickstarter project, and will also be added for free download when it is completed. Estimated delivery is 1-2 weeks after funds clear for this project.
Combined, the Planet Portfolios provide over 100 VTT assets for your spacefaring adventures including: stars, rocky planets, terra-like planets, gas giants, moons, asteroids, dwarf planets, comets, and more!
The Week #1 Feature Edition is Starship Deckplan Maps! A series of 20 detailed starship deckpans has been added to the collection. Like all other maps, these will include GM, Player, and VTT versions.
Also, for each stretch goal bonus map or mini-funding goal bonus map added to the campaign an additional starship deckplan map will be added as well!
The Week #3 Featured Addition heralds the arrival of an all new Add-on option! The Starship Builder Kits. Want to try it out? Click here to download it right now. If you want the rest of the kits, you can get them as an add-on by increasing your pledge by $25.
Each kit includes 20 ship sections that allow you to easily create your own customized starship deckplan!
There are 5 core kits, and for every $5k this kickstarter funds, another 5 sets will be added. That means right now there are 25 kits (500 starship sections) with more to be added to the add-on as funding continues to increase!
Designed to allow you to utilize various stylized starship sections to compile your very own custom starship deckplan. Each kits is designed to allow you to mix-and-match any of the sections included with sections included in other sets in the series.
Stretch Goals: For every 50 backers that pledge to this Kickstarter campaign, one full-page, full-color bonus map will be added to the collection. This even includes the $1 backer level count, so get your friends to back for a buck and get more maps into Volume 2 of the Big Book of Maps!
These bonus maps will be included in the final book and will be released via the backer-only website on a staggered schedule as time permits.
Please Note: Should this project result in a very large number of backers, the process of creating the bonus maps could delay the final release of the PDF and Print versions of the book. However, there will be no delay in the twice-weekly release schedule of digital maps to applicable backers.
In addition to the bonus map stretch goals based on the number of backers, an additional series of stretch goals based on overall amount pledged to the project can be unlocked.
Stretch Goals ($1k - $14k): When the project is funded, and for every $500 pledged beyond the project's $1,000 funding goal up to $14k, a series of 10 all-new map icons will be unlocked for backers.
Super Stretch Goals ($15k +): When the project reaches $15k funding, and for every additional $1,000 pledged beyond that, an additional map icon is added to every previously unlocked map icon set. That's 27 new map icons for every super stretch goal unlocked!
Bonus Stretch Goals: There will periodically be threshold-based bonus stretch goals that are in addition to the planned recurring stretch goals. This include special bonuses that are unlocked at the $5k, $10k, $15 and $20 funding levels.
The icons will be released in themed packs as they are created, and made available to all backers via "backers only" updates here on Kickstarter as well as the Digital Distribution Tool.
All of these unlocked map icons will even be available to $1 backers -- so everyone who shows support for the project walks away with something worthwhile!
Map icons are the various elements that can be placed onto a dungeon map via a virtual tabletop (VTT) platform or graphic editing software. This includes objects such as doors, treasure chests, furniture, traps, treasure, etc.
For the purpose of this project these map icons will be provided as PNG graphic files with transparent backgrounds (to allow easy import and placement via VTT software).
Example of how map icons will be released in sets.
The map icons will be released to all backers in themed sets as they are created. A “complete collection” of the map icons in a single download will also be made available for backers at the end of this project’s creation phase.
The map icons produced by this project are super-high 600 dpi resolution and especially created to properly accompany the matching high resolution digital maps offered. This means the map icons will also scale up to poster-map quality.
The planned release schedule for the map icon sets is once weekly starting the day the project funds clear. These sets will be made available to all backers via the Digital Distribution Tool.
Each map set initially includes 10 totally different map icons (not just color/texture variations). The number of icons in each set can be increased via unlocked stretch goals beginning at the $15k funding level.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This project is relatively low risk as all backers at the $20 (or higher) levels will be receiving the content on a weekly basis as it is created. 

Also, it is identical in format to my last Kickstarter for Volume 1 of the Big Book of Maps -- which delivered more than two months ahead of schedule, and also had a 20% increase in content size (just for fun). 

I am confident that I won't have any issues delivering again. 

This is the second Kickstarter project that I have created myself. However, I have years of experience with designing or running successful Kickstarter projects for various publishers (including some of the most successful Kickstarter projects by AAW Games and Kobold Press). This isn't my first rodeo, and I have already learned many of the "difficult lessons" that many first time project creators face.

In comparison with some of the more complex Kickstarter projects I've assisted with, this project is very straight forward. I foresee no likely hurdles in providing backers with the completed product as promised.

However, as with any project in the making, there are inherent risks. As the sole producer of this material, if something where to happen to me that prevented continued content creation the project could become delayed. Even in that unlikely event, backers would still have full access to all of the content that was created for the project up to that point and a contingency is in place to release any pending and completed maps to backers should the gods choose to cast lightning to strike me down.

If you have any further questions or concerns, please drop me a message in the comments section for this project and I'll get an answer to you as soon as possible (as well as updating the FAQ here if deemed necessary).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
This is the first update I've done directly for this project in a very long time. I apologize for that. I've kept direct replies and messages timely and have been checking in via comments from time to time. For those who haven't checked either this is a general update for everyone.

In brief: I have finally wrangled my health back under control via medication and lifestyle changes, I am in a much better place mentally and emotionally than I have been as well, and am working steadily on regaining full mobility once again. It's been a rough period in my life (add in the woes of 2020 along with it, and it's been a double-whammy).  I truly wish I could have completed this project timely, responsibly, and professionally, but life just didn't cooperate. However, for the first time since this project went off course I feel like I'm back in a good place and am finding myself highly productive again. I'm eager to dive back in and get this project wrapped-up ASAP.

Good morning BBM2 backers! 
Having spent June adjusting my personal and family life, making some important decisions, setting some major life changes into motion, and wireframing plans for the near and far future. I feel like I’m in a good place creatively and mentally again for the first time in months. 
While a lot of content for this project has already been released to backers, the project is now three months behind schedule for the content still pending. After a couple failed attempts to get things rolling again,  It was an unwanted and unexpected side-trek, but sometimes life throws a curveball and things go a bit sideways. There are no excuses—it just happened.

updates.update_userinfo: BIG BOOK OF MAPS VOLUME 2 UPDATE
updates.update_content:
Good morning, backers! Today is April 1st, and seeing as you don’t have Volume 2 of the Big Book of Maps sitting in your inbox, that means that the project has fallen behind the estimated fulfillment date of March 2019. 
A sizeable amount of content for this project has already been released via the Digital Distribution Tool, but simply put, this project got away from me over the past several months.

This update has been a long time coming (detailed explanation provided later in this post), but "The Big Book of Maps for Tabletop Roleplaying Games - Volume 2: Science Fiction" project has made quite a bit of progress in the past few months.
In this update we'll cover where we currently stand with this project, and what the plans for October 2018 are.

Good morning, everyone! I hope the week finds you well. As we're rolling into the month of May, It's time for the Month-End Summary Update for The Big Book of Maps Volume 2!
We didn't have a full month to do a summary of in April, 2018 (after the launch of the Digital Distribution Tool on the 9th), but I did want to start the habit of consistently touching base with backers and recapping the work done over the previous month.

campaign.story:
Summerland is a game about desolation and redemption in a post-apocalyptic world destroyed by a vast supernatural forest. The game was first published nearly ten years ago, and has since been translated in to French, Catalan and Spanish.
This Kickstarter is to fund the creation of a new full-colour version of the game with improved mechanics based on the Open D6 system, in 200 page 6"x9" book format.
In Summerland, players take on the roles of Drifters, characters who travel beneath the Sea of Leaves, the vast supernatural forest that has devastated the works of humanity. They are driven to constantly move on due to a past trauma that while protecting them from the Call, the siren-song of the forest, prohibits them from being accepted in to what's left of society. Instead they must confront their past, resolve their trauma and at last join the remainder of humanity. Like my last game Exilium, also funded via Kickstarter and delivered earlier than anticipated, this new version of Summerland uses mechanics specifically to model the process redemption, giving the game a clear 'end-game' linked to actual play.
The original version of the game came out around ten years ago, quickly followed by a revised and expanded edition. I'm now raising funds for a new full colour second edition of Sumerland, with new mechanics based on the Open D6 rules set as used in Exilium, so still rules light, but modified to fit the themes and goals of Summerland.
Summerland has been out for some time in it's original form with different mechanics to this new version. Check out some reviews at the links below (and bear in mind what's changed in this new edition, listed in the next section)...
http://mostunreadblogever.blogspot.co.uk/2012/08/tommys-take-on-summerland-revised-and.html
https://forum.rpg.net/showthread.php?483617-Summerland-Any-good
http://www.bluestockings.ca/2014/09/game-review-summerland.html
DrivethruRPG customers:
'What captivated me about this setting was the mysteries and the connection to nature. It reminded me very much of the books of Robert Holdstock, where a huge forest places an important role as well. There is something strange here that I hope to one day explore! The cover art is amazing!
Rating: [4 of 5 Stars!]'
'The premise is both intriguing and deceptively simple: a primeval forest has overtaken the world overnight, destroying civilization in one fell swoop. Why and how? That's up to the narrator to decide--or to leave as a mystery. It's an evocative, open-ended setting with unlimited possibilities and designed with an eye to letting the players and narrator create a very personal, collaborative story. Personally, it's just the thing I was looking for. I can't wait to play it.
Rating: [5 of 5 Stars!]'
Since it's release, Summerland has been translated into French, Catalan and Spanish.
For a Q&A on the new edition which talks about the game, check the link below:
https://gmshoe.wordpress.com/2018/02/23/qa-greg-saunders-summerland-2nd-edition/
The core of the game is identical, the setting material and 'Fallen leaves' the sandbox campaign, are all as before. There are two main changes...
Full colour layout, featuring art from the talented Tithi Luadthong. The original game was black and white with treated photos. This version will be packed full of wonderful and evocative art like below in both one page and double page spreads. The game will also feature the beautiful original cover by Paul Bourne of Cubicle 7, modified for the new edition.
  New Open D6 engine. The original game had a short, very narrative rule set, which these days has proven to be insufficiently robust in play. So it's been replaced by the Open D6 rules based on MiniSix from Anti-Paladin games that I used with my other game Eixlium. The rules for resolving traumas and stress are the same however, as they riff off of die results from actions.
Sample of the layout:
  The Open D6 game system is extremely versatile, and can be implemented in various degrees of detail for games that are light to heavy in style. Summerland is definitely rules light, but that doesn't mean you couldn't bolt on things you like from the free to download Open D6 rule books. It's a great, simple versatile system, so that's why I use it in my games.
  There are two main tiers - one for a PDF of Summerland, one for PDF+softcover and one for PDF+hard cover. The books will be formatted to 6"x9" dimensions and are expected to clock in at 200 pages. We will be using DriveThruRPG for fulfillment.
PDF vouchers will be sent out when the project completes for the final product.
Print copies will be produced by DriveThruRPG as well, slightly after the final PDF is produced to allow for proofs to be ordered. campaign.story:
The Wild Hunt is an ancient Celtic myth about a force that rampages through the countryside: killing evil-doers and causing havoc. 
But what if there is a certain truth behind it?
Breaking off from the main Irish rebel organisation, a splinter group has discovered a means of summoning the Wild Hunt to do their bidding and aid them in their criminal enterprise.
Except it has not gone to plan. Their binding knowledge is poor and the entities of the Wild Hunt strain against their bonds. The splinter group is holding a hungry tiger by the tail and can only keep the Hunt busy lest it turn on them. They seek out the Investigators and endeavour to strike a devil's bargain; help them end or control the monsters, or see them create a bloodbath the likes the North-East of America has never seen.
Can the rebel group be trusted?
Can the Investigators walk away and live with their decision?
Can the Wild Hunt be controlled? And by whom?

It is time for you to find out!
Call of Cthulhu is the Registered Trademark of Chaosium Inc., and is used with their permission. www.chaosium.com.
The book will also contain the main adventure written by Tyler Omichinski, NPCs, plans, scenario seeds, and options to expand the Investigators' dealings with the Wild Hunt. Layout will be by Stephanie McAlea, but we'd like to add further art by creators we admire and trust to deliver. This is where the Kickstarter funds come in.
Taking its inspirational cues from Celtic myth, classic monsters, and H.P. Lovecraft, the book takes a mature look at the horror of Mythos interpretations by historic cultures and will also summarise the tragedy of terrorism, self-determination, and their links to organised crime. There will also be information on how Celtic cultures in Britain and Ireland re-interpret the mythos to fit their cultural narrative and, as the subjects within can be sensitive for many, this book is for mature gamers only. 
The funds for this Kickstarter will go towards commissioning more art and the hiring more writers and creatives of quality if the book is to expand. The funds will also go on printing and distribution.
Unlike their characters who face insanity and death, backers can look forward to lovingly produced PDFs, Softcover and Hardcover books, and increased quality and content depending on stretch goals.
At the moment, the books are 90 pages and will be perfect bound. They will have a colour cover and greyscale internal pages. Due to stretch goals, these are all subject to change.
The entire cost of your books and getting them to you is covered by your pledge.
The top tier reward is slightly different. Those who pledge at this level can look forward to Stygian Fox's owner, Stephanie McAlea, running a scenario at the Continuum gaming convention on the 21st of July at Oadby Campus, in Leicester, UK. It will be an abridged version of The Wild Hunt with pre-generated characters.
As the book won't be ready for distribution at this point, backers at this level will receive their copies in due course but will also receive copies of some of our previous titles and other goodies as a thank you for backing!
A Note of Caution
The onus is on the backer to attend the convention and they must at least have a day ticket already purchased before pledging. Stygian Fox is not responsible for the backer failing to attend due to illness, act of a deity, or rail strikes. No refunds will be forthcoming for a failure to attend. 
All convention rules must be adhered to and those not doing so, or flouting 'Wheaton's Law', will be removed from the table (and possibly the convention) immediately and without refund or compensatory gifts from Stygian Fox/Miss McAlea.
These rules are strict to protect both Stygian Fox/Miss McAlea but also other players and conventioneers. I'm sure you understand.
More information on this most excellent of gaming conventions can be found here: https://continuumconvention.co.uk/
With this project, our focus is to produce a beautiful and entertaining book but budget and time constraints may hamper that. With stretch goals and the economy of scale, we hope to furnish the book with better maps, more information and art, and have a premium level of quality in regards to printing and binding. If we're lucky enough to reach the top level we'll pay our writers and artists more for helping us get there. Admittedly, this doesn't benefit our backers but as pay in the RPG industry is seriously low, I'm sure you'll want to help the creatives involved to get a bonus.

Lap tables that hold character sheets for tabletop role playing games!

They're used for making everything neat and organized and keeping people from stealing your pencil and dice. They hold up to twenty character sheets that can be turned over like a book due to being kept in place with ultra strong neodymium magnets. They can be removed and changed around. There are trays to store and roll dice, or you can roll them on the main board.

When you're finished you put the lid on and everything is carried and stored safely until your next game.

They're made to set free your role playing games, making them more mobile and reducing setup and takedown time. They free up space on the games table and they even allow games to take place without a table. You can play on the sofa, in a hammock, on the lawn, in bed, around a camp fire. You can keep three in the back of the car to keep the kids occupied during long journeys.






We designed the OS Board, it's for philistines, barbarians and the old school elite who only need a pencil, paper and dice to restore order to the realm. It has a lid to help you transport everything and a large A5 (or a Junior Letter pad for US/Can orders). It can be rotated to suit people who are left or right handed.







We designed the MN Board, it's more compact, thinner and without a lid it is light enough to dual wield. It's ideal for the games master to keep several at home to lend out when people come over to play. It holds a mobile phone or other small device for using apps or linking over skype. Comes in left and right handed options and features as A7 Pad (This has been modified to 76mm x 76mm to fit yellow stickies or 3inch square pads). Available in left or right handed options.







We designed SF Board, it's a techy version that has Tablet and Mobile Phone dock for apps, browsers and skype games as well as a lid. Comes with an A6 (or a 4.25” x 5.5” pad for US/Can orders) pad and available in left and right handed options.
 



We designed the GM Board, it does lots, but not only does it do lots but you can customize how you use it so it does lots of what you want it to do. It has everything the others have and then a bit more, most notably 7 white GM Tabs form a GM screen.
Note: Due to extensive backer feedback the GM Board has been modified. the A5 ring bound pad has been removed. In its place there is a tray for miniatures, a smaller notepad and 4 areas for different coloured post-it notes/stickies. This seems a fairly unanimous upgrade in function. The GM board still features 7 GM Tabs and all are the full height (not different heights as featured on the production prototypes video)

______________________________________________
Specification/Details:
Production: CNC machined to 0.2mm accuracy by Novacrylics Engineering, my family company run by me and my brother in Warwickshire, England. Magnets: Specially developed Chrome plated Neodymium-Iron-Boron magnets, losing only 1% of their strength per decade. These magnets are safe to use with electronic devices such as laptops, tablets and mobile phones.

Backer Security: Please read my profile and learn about what resources and experience I have behind me

Product Security: Patent Pending and Registered Design in major world markets.

Wood: High quality, sustainable, cavity free, FSC rated Birch Ply
Tablet and Phone Compatibility: Compatible with all known tablets. If you roll a critical fail on your choice of tablet and you got an oval one or something then thats too bad, but we tried nearly 30 different tablets and every one of them sat on it just fine. Phones wider than 70mm don't sit well on the MN and the SF but are fine on the GM.

GM Tabs: The GM tabs acting as a screen on the GM Board are made of cast PMMA with an mirco-etched finish allowing them to be drawn on with a normal pencil (is exactly the same as using a chalk board). Pencil marks can be removed with an eraser. In testing the tabs have been written and erased over 100 times with no effect to function, it is likely they can be used an unlimited number of times. In addition you can write on the tabs with a permanent marker which doesn't come off allowing hitpoint counters which stay in place even if you cross off and erase hitpoint ticks.

Pads come with the boards and are available cheaply as refils. Links will be sent at the end of the kickstarter for the cheapest pads sourced.

Mat
matnoo@hotmail.com

updates.update_content:
Hey,
Just to be clear, wave one, two and three are all dispatched. The special engraved orders that were advertised as a delayed arrival date on the store and on updates have also gone out in wave three. Delivery is taking longer than suggested (and strangely enough parcels to the same cities are arriving at different times. This is likely due to processing and/or customs, but I’m not sure.

Hello, I will be brief.

We sent out the first wave which was largely as described in update 16, however, there were a few stragglers. We filled up several pallets with your rewards but unfortunately there were a few left over (about 80 kilos which we could not fit on that shipment) this is a very small number of orders and likely explains the few people on the message board who are confused about being told they would likely have theirs soon, but have heard nothing as yet.

Sincere apologies for the confusion.

I can guarantee the second wave is leaving here tomorrow, which is everyones reward dispatched, the only exceptions being rewards containing specially engraved boards (which were advertised in backerkit as having a delayed delivery date). These will go out early next week.

There are plenty of other questions I will answer very soon, but I am working hard managing the special orders right now and need to make sure that before I solve any delivery or picking issues that I don't make more problems in the future. We work in a metal box and its currently 36C! How ironic when I think of the weather conditions when we first started!

General messages please leave on the message board, I will get them when I have spare time to look (I very much appreciate the appreciation!) but I don't get notifications for the message board, so any issues or direct questions it is best to contact me directly on matnoo@hotmail.com

We're nearly done. So close!

There are surprisingly few issues do I hope will resolve them all within a week or so. I need to get the remainder of orders out the door first though. Thanks for your patience once again.

Mat

campaign.story:
The Black Monk is a series of five games set in a strange fantasy world where time means nothing anymore. Each game is set in a unique part of a desolate world, with strange characters passing the time until the Black Monk visits.
In between these visits, the character's lives are interrupted by sometimes trivial and other times confusing events. Everything seems to fit together like an elongated jigsaw puzzle, but no one can see the starter pieces stretching across the horizon.
But they don’t complain. There is always more work. The village needs workers.
Then one evening, the sun stayed in the sky all day. When there should have been night, the sun remained. And now it feels as though it’s been years since the Black Monk came. But perhaps it was yesterday. Nothing is right…
Is that blood?
The first Black Monk game was written a year ago and is available online. For completion's sake, it is available through this kickstarter as well.
  In The Black Monk, Sunrise End the characters live in a desolate, but vibrant world where time seems to have lost meaning. Living for decades, perhaps longer, in isolation from others, the people of Gallow’s Dawn toil in work, visited often by a mysterious and powerful figure known as the Black Monk.
Whenever the Black Monk visits, the sun disappears and night falls over the village. Whenever the Black Monk leaves, the sun reappears and hangs in the sky for days on end. While the sun is still there, there is work to be done. And when the sun disappears, the people of Gallow’s Dawn can rest.
But the people of Gallow’s Dawn want neither work, nor rest. They want an end to this seemingly meaningless cycle of tedium and punishment. The Black Monk is neither wicked, nor fair. He just is. A thing that predates the valley. A thing that predates reason.
Is that the sun returning?
  People can come and go as they please, but why would they want to. Thornwood is paradise. Granted, the Thornwood Beast haunts the forest just outside the village. But if you avoid the forest, you’re fine. No harm can come to those who just do their work and enjoy the fruits of eternity.
But stories have began that a figure known as the Black Monk has been traveling the countryside. Sometimes his visits bring sickness. Other times redemption. No one has ever heard of him before, so these are obviously rumors. Who would dare interrupt paradise?
Why is the sun fading?
  In The Black Monk, Oubliette the characters live inside a dark monastery that’s been turned into a self-made prison. It’s name is Absalom, home to roughly 100 people, all living in fear of the outside world.
The outside world. Desolate. A place where time has lost all meaning. A place where a host of unimaginable monsters dwell, including the undying Black Monk. A vile man bent on keeping the inhabitants of Absalom alive just long enough to drive them insane.
Whenever the Black Monk visits, the sun disappears and night falls over the valley. The people retreat to the monastery. Whenever the Black Monk leaves, the sun reappears and hangs in the sky for days on end. For hours after, the residents remain, fearing a surprise return of the Black Monk.
Inside, the hours drag on. Endlessly. It’s cold. Is this eternity? Or damnation?
How are there shadows inside the darkness?
  It’s been ages since the Black Monk visited and the people of Witherfall  built a tower in preparation for his return. They no longer fear his reprisals and sudden turns of mood. They have readied themselves.
There will be no more suffering.
The sun is fading now. The torches are lit, the boiling oil and defensive machinery are ready. It’s only a matter of time before the Black Monk is finally sundered and returned to the ether.
Is that an army of shadows he brings with him? Or just more damned?
  Black Monk, and all its extensions, utilize an innovative game system called Praxis.
Praxis is GMless gaming at its best, offering player motivations, and broad outlines that allow you to take a deep dive into the characters without distracting, overt maneuvering.
Everything is character driven. You and your fellow gamers, are characters inside the story and authors outside the story. You create scenes based on your individual character wants and needs. If you succeed at a milestone, you move forward in the story along one path. If you fail, your side effects (trepidation) open story pathways in another direction.
Everything you need for your specific character is on a character sheet like this one.
Each player receives a unique character sheet to build their characters. Each sheet provides world building questions, character motivations, relationships with others, names, quirks, abilities, and so on. It acts as a guide encouraging players to fully flesh out the “world” their characters inhabit and since no two sheets are the same and much of the play centers on how your character interacts with the others in the game, it virtually guarantees that no two gaming experiences are the same. Ever.
Black Monk is 96 pages long, complete with all the rules, advice, and character sheets needed to play.
This project is 99% complete, with the exception of game 6 and the omnibus. Within a month of the project funding, I hit the print book button and ship your game. Don't expect any long-winded updates about the project being delayed. Because it's done. The day the project ends, I hit send and your book gets printed and shipped.
(Or we can exchange the hostage in a parking lot, somewhere.)
You are buying a finished game. A progressive step in GMless games. A project that I'm really proud of.
I love playing these games.
  At $1000, all five games fund and I send out PDFs and books to all the backers. However, if we get further along, the following additional character (and stretch goals) are given to backers for free based on their pledge level.
Each game already comes with six characters.
The Homunculus from book 2 and the Green Manalishi from book 3.
The Red Pope from book 4 and the Rat Fiend from book 5.
The Doomfairy from book 2 and the Thornwood Beast from book 3.
The Chimeric Gargouille from book 4 and the Rat King from book 5.
  The Embalmer from book 2 and the Dryad from book 3.
 The Sexton from book 4 and the Golem from book 5
This is the big stretch goal. At this level, I release a 6th game in the series, along with both of it's advanced character classes: the Cyclops and the Lord of Locusts. No details about this game are being revealed at this time. I will reveal the game title when we reach this level.
I also make quick-reference scene cards available with all the scene types defined in handy cards that you can place on the table for players. More on this later.
  The TBN from book 2 and the Judas Lantern from book 3
The Bailiff from book 4 and the Sculptor from book 5
I create and offer the Black Monk omnibus: all six games in one book. Backers have the option of getting a hardcover version that would never be available once the kickstarter concludes.
Two additional free characters for use in ANY black monk game. TBD.
Character compendium created, which I think is essentially what people wanted from the omnibus. All 40+ characters in one PDF package. Free to backers of $33 or more. A book of characters will also be created, but not for free. More on this in the coming months.
Seriously, if we make it this far, I'll have to do something amazingly cool. Maybe a 7th black monk game. Yes. I'm already brainstorming another story.

campaign.story:
Operators is an RPG designed to tell cinematic action movies at the table. Whether you like challenge-based play in a Tom Clancian technothriller or the futuristic hijinks of Mission Impossible, Operators has you covered. 
  The core mechanic revolves around rolling four Fate Dice. Players look for pluses in order to succeed and the Game Master looks for minuses that mean the task becomes unexpectedly complicated. 
Operators also uses a deck of cards to help narrate fight scenes and chase scenes. The Fight Cards all have unique illustrations and moves taken from various martial arts, but mostly those seen in the Bourne movies. These cards, along with rolling the dice to see which moves land, are turned away, or are countered, make it easy to narrate a kinetic fight scene. Chase cards work similarly, except instead of having fighting moves on them, they have the ways the person in the lead tries to get away.
You can find a free quickstart of the game and all the mechanics in depth right here. along with some additional player aides for the Game Master (called Director in Operators) and some mock-up character sheets with a loose scenario to play through if you and you group want to get it to the table to see how she runs.
Click to download the free Quickstart - still a work in progress
 
The book is going to be graphic novel size, softcover, full colour, and around 200 pages.
The Cards will be a deck of 52 cards in total and will be regular playing card size (2.5 x 3.5"). 19 of them are used for Chase Scenes, 33 are used for Fight Scenes. One of the main goals of the kickstarter is going to be increasing the size of that deck. I'm hoping to add quite a bit more. In the quickstart above you can check out what the cards I already have look like.
Cards Mock-Up (Not Final)
In addition, these cards can be used with all kinds of other games, like Night's Black Agents, Delta Green, or any other game where you want to narrate out a brutal martial arts sequence between opponents.
I also want to be able to hire a professional to do photo manipulation and photo realistic art throughout the book. It's a big challenge since it's not a style that is commonly seen in RPGs and I'd really like to do it right.
If you know any of my other projects, you know it pays to back my stuff on kickstarter. You'll get it first, and you'll get it cheaper. No sales a couple months after the product's release, no selling at conventions like Gen Con before you've got it. You'll get a discount off the MSRP, as seen in the reward tiers, and you have my guarantee no one will get it cheaper than you for at the very least a year. I value each and every backer and know that I would not be able to publish games without you. Thank you so much.
  If you'd like to hear me talk a bit about the game, there's an interview up with Jason Cordova of The Gauntlet Podcast. Please check it out!
INTERVIEW

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our fifth kickstarter, third under the Samjoko Publishing name. I will be using the same printer in South Korea, the same fulfillment services (The Dice Latte and Indie Press Revolution). We've also got much of the same team in place for art and editing.

International backers (anyone outside of the U.S.) will receive their packages from Korea, from the Dice Latte game cafe in Seoul. Anyone in the U.S. will be receiving their packages from Indie Press Revolution and I have every confidence in both of them. We had some issues shipping stuff on Chinese New Year the first time we did fulfillment in Korea, so we've learned our lesson there and will be avoiding that time.

I've found that most delays tend to stem from art and coordinating the schedule of getting the art and layout schedule right. While I can't be certain that artists will deliver on time, I've reduced this risk considerably by purchasing a great deal of it, the cards in particular, up front to off set any issues getting it out the door.

That said, since this project is essentially two-in-one, with the cards and the book together, I decided to leave myself a bit of leeway space for delivery. That said, the cards should be ready pretty quick, and well before the book as all that needs to be done there is ordering additional arts for the cards and then dropping them into the already-done templates we have.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
